Pours deodorizing agent into air-purifier containers. May clean and disinfect equipment, such as urinals, toilet bowls, and washbasins, using brushes, sponges, and cleaning agents. May attach equipment to washroom wall.

Title: PNEUMATIC-TUBE REPAIRMAN
Definition: tube repairman. Repairs and maintains pneumatic-tube carrier system, using handtools and precision-measuring instruments: Locates sources of trouble. Repairs and installs parts, using handtools.

Title: SEWING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates sewing machine to Join parts of canvas products, such as awnings, banners, flags, tents, or tarpaulins: May stitch binding tape to exposed edges, or stitch tippers to products. May be designated according to type of article Joined or type of stitch sewn as AWNING ASSEMBLER; AWNING BINDER; CLOTH JOINER, TENTS; FLAG SEWER; POCKET SEWER; SCALLOP BINDER; TENT ASSEMBLER; WING SEWER.

Title: OCRANOGRAPHER, GEOLOGICAL
Definition: geologist, marine. Studies topographic features, rocks, and sediments of ocean bottom.

Title: CIGAR MAKER
Definition: finished -cigar maker; out-and-out cigar maker, hand; stogie maker, hand. Rolls cigars by hand: Rolls filler, wraps filler with binder [BUNCH MAKER, HAND], and wraps bunch with wrapper leaf [ROLLER HAND I]. Presses cigars In molds to obtain finished shape [MOLD PRESSMAN]. May be designated by type of cigar rolled as TOBY MAKER.

Title: MUSIC SUPERVISOR
Definition: Coordinates music education program in school system and supervises teaching staff engaged in instructing classes in vocal or instrumental music: Consults with teaching and administrative staff to plan and develop music education curriculum. Observes, evaluates, and recommends changes in work of teaching staff to strengthen teaching skills in classroom. Analyzes music education program periodically to evaluate effectiveness of instructional methods and materials. Orders instructional materials, supplies, equipment, and visual aids designed to meet training needs of students. Approves school purchases of musical Instruments for students. Directs and inspects repair of instruments. Establishes interschool orchestra, band, and choral group to represent schools at civic and community events.

Title: HOP WEIGHER
Definition: weigher. Weighs hops used in brewing beer: Selects bale of prescribed hops from storage area in hop room and transports bale to work area, using hand truck. Opens burlap wrapping of bale, using knife. Breaks bale into chunks and throws chunks into basket on platform scale. Fills basket to prescribed number of pounds. Wheels filled baskets to brew kettles.

Title: DANCER
Definition: Performs dances alone, with partner, or in groups, such as corps de ballet or chorus ensemble, to entertain audience: Performs classical, modern, or acrobatic dances, coordinating body movements and facial expressions with musical accompaniment to express theme of dance. Rehearses dance routines developed by CHOREOGRAPHER. May perform original dances. May sing and provide other forms of entertainment. May spedalize in particular style of dancing and be designated according to specialty as ACRORATIC DANCER; BALLET DANCER; BALLROOM DANCER; CHORUS DANCER; INTERPRETATIVE DANCER; TAP DANCER.

Title: CEMENTER, MACHINE APPLICATOR
Definition: Applies cement onto separate shoe parts prior to joining, performing one or more of following operations: (1) Feeds parts between pressure and cementing rollers of machine and removes cemented parts. (2) Holds part against cement -covered roller or revolving brash that applies cement to part. (3) Feeds parts between rollers that move parts under spray nozzle. (4) Holds parts under machine- applicator nozzle. May fill cement reservoir. May join parts together. Maybe designated according to parts coated as BINDING CE- MENTER, FRENCH CORD; BOTTOM CEMENTER; CEmenter for folding, machine; channel cementer,INSOLE, MACHINE; CHANNEL CEMENTER, OUTSOLE, MACHINE; HEEL CEMENTER, MACHINE. See volume II for additional titles.

Title: BARKER
Definition: ballyhoo man; carney; contact spieler. Attempts to attract patrons to entertainment by exhorting passing public, describing attractions of show and emphasizing variety, novelty, beauty, or some other feature he believes will influence listeners to attend entertainment. May conduct brief free show, introducing performers and describing their acts to be given at feature performance.

Title: HYDRAULIC-STRAINER OPERATOR
Definition: filter operator. Operates hydraulic filter machine to remove foreign matter from plastics material: Cuts plastics dough into slabs, using knife, or rolls material into lump and packs it into cylinder. Selects and installs wire and cloth strainers and die heads in machine, according to type and form of material, using handtools. Adjusts controls of hydraulic ram, according to pressure gage reading, and starts machine to force material through strainers. Cleans strainers, die head, and machine cylinder, using brushes, scrapers, and solvents. Records amounts and type of dough strained.

Title: CORE ANALYST
Definition: core- analysis engineer. Analyzes cores taken from subsurface earth formations for porosity, permeability, oil or water saturation, combustible gas content, and amount of gas by volume to determine productivity of oil or gas bearing formations: Cleans cores with knife or scraper or breaks off outside surface with hammer to remove drilling fluid deposits. Examines cores under ultraviolet light for fluorescence indicating presence of oil. Heats cores in retort, condenses oil or water vapors, and measures volume of condensates, using balance scales and other instruments. Interprets findings to evaluate productive potential of oil- or gas-bearing formation.

Title: LEATHER FINISHER
Definition: presser, leather garments. Operates hot-head pressing machine to press and shape drycleaned leather or suede garments: Positions garment on buck of machine and pushes buttons to lower pressing head of machine onto garment. Rearranges garment on buck, repeating process until pressing is completed. Brushes suede to raise nap.

Title: MOBILE-LOUNGE DRIVER
Definition: Drives mobile lounge to transport aircraft passengers between airport terminal building and aircraft on runway.

Title: STONE SETTER
Definition: Sets cut and dressed ornamental and structural stone in buildings: Spreads mortar over stone with trowel. Sets stone in mortar, usually with aid of hoist, and moves it into final position with mallet, hammer, or crowbar.May fasten stone to supports with metal ties or anchors. May finish joints between stones with a pointing trowel. May clean surface of stone walls by scraping and scrubbing with muriatic acid.

Title: SALESMAN, RADIO AND TELEVISION PARTS
Definition: salesman, electronic components. Sells radio, television, and other electronics parts to establishments, such as appliance stores, dealers, and repair shops, or electronics and aircraft manufacturing firms, performing duties as described under

Title: INSPECTOR, CHIEF
Definition: see WAX PATTERN REPAIRER.

Title: SKYING WATCHER
Definition: scaffold man. Tends intermediate units, such as washboxes, oxidizing rollers, or drying cans of indigo-vat dyeing range, that dye warp yarn in continuous form: Patrols area between entry and terminal units of range, walking along scaffold, and observes flow of yarn through machines or over rollers to detect breaks or tangles in yarn. Stops machine, untangles yarn, and ties broken yarn ends. Mounts ball warps onto creel at feed end of machine with aid of WARP-DYEING VAT TENDER or WARP COILER. Works as member of team to clean machine, using water hose, detergents, and brush.

Title: BROOMCORN GRADER
Definition: broomcorn sorter. Sorts broomcorn fibers according to specified length and quality to determine fibers to be used as cores or outer layer: Opens bales of broomcorn stems with wire cutter or removes bleached fibers from bleach- house. Examines and removes stems which are short, off-color, broken, or do not otherwise meet standards. Measures lengths of standard stems or panicles, using grading table scale. Determines grade of stems according to length, color, and fineness of fiber. Bundles and labels graded broomcorn. May remove seeds and straighten fibers [BROOMCORN SEEDER] or out stalks to length [CUTTER].

Title: BACK TENDER, PAPER MACHINE
Definition: second hand, paper machine. Operates drier, calendar, and winding sections of four drainer or cylinder- type paper making machines to produce paper and wind it onto rolls: Threads continuous sheet of paper through carrier, drier, and calendar rolls by hand. Observes charts and gages and turns valves to adjust steam pressure, temperature of drier and calendar rolls, and hot air blowing onto continuous sheet. Turns wheels to adjust tension on rolls and control running speed of sheet. Inspects sheet for defects, such as dirt, slime spots, holes, and wrinkles, and marks defective portions for removal at rewinding section. Directs workers engaged in winding and rewinding, slitting, weighing, wrapping, and stenciling paper rolls. May operate size tub or spray paper with steam, water, or dyes to obtain specified finish. May operate drying section only to produce rolls or sheets of dry pulp and be designated Back TENDER, PULP DRIER. May be designated according to type of machine as BACK TENDER, CYLINDER; BACK TENDER, FOURDRINIER.

Title: TACKER, ELASTIC BAND
Definition: Operates sewing machine to join ends of elastic bands that form tops for hose. Overlaps ends of elastic band and guides under needle of machine.

Title: BRINE-MIXER OPERATOR, AUTOMATIC
Definition: Tends machine that mixes water and salt to prepare brine solution for use in separating immatured from matured peas and beans: Turns valves to transfer solution from mixing machine to storage or separator tanks. Tests specific gravity of solution with hydrometer and adds water or salt to bring solution to specified density. May clean machinery and equipment, using steam hose, soap, and brushes.

Title: SECOND HELPER
Definition: 502484.open- hearth-furnace-operator helper. Assists FIRST HELPER in operation of open hearth furnaces: Cleans furnace tapholes, using scraper and oxygen lance. Closes furnace tapholes with pipe, chrome ore, dolomite, or magnetite to prevent loss of molten metal and relines steel runners. Weighs additives, such as fluorspar, lime, and manganese, and wheels them to furnace areas. Shovels refractory materials into furnace. Assists crew in slagging or flushing furnace. Starts furnace by igniting gas, using torch. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: ACID-LINE FOREMAN
Definition: add supervisor. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in storing adds, manufacturing nitric acid, and mixing adds for use in producing nitroglycerin or TNT. May supervise production of ammonium nitrate crystals and drying of dynamite-filler ingredients. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: METAL-FINISH INSPECTOR
Definition: Examines interior and exterior of Assembled lacquered, enameled, or varnished pieces of metal furniture for defects in construction or finish. Rejects faulty pieces and returns them to proper departments for correction. Applies manufacturer's label to accepted pieces.

Title: PRODUCTION-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: Tends one or more automatic machines to head, trim, roll-thread, slot, or tap metal stock to produce nuts, bolts, or other fasteners: Feeds machine by filling hoppers or loading coiled steel on reel and threading end of coil through feed rolls. Starts machine and observes operation. Measures parts, using rule or fixed gage, to determine conformance to specifications. Frees stock jammed in feed mechanism, using rod. Stops machine and notifies supervisor when machine malfunctions or parts do not conform to specifications. May install and adjust cutting tools on machine, using wrench and rule. May be designated according to type of machine tended as TAPPING-MACHINE OPERATOR, AUTOMATIC.

Title: POULTRY KILLER
Definition: sticker. Severs Jugular vein with knife to slaughter suspended fowl passing on overhead conveyor.

Title: ABLE-LAY-OUT MAN
Definition: Plots and draws diagrams for making electric cables, following blueprints and written specifications: Lifts layout board to workbench and staples drawing paper to board. Draws full scale diagram of cable on board, using rule, T-square, straightedge, and pencil. Measures and marks locations for such things as cable arms and trim and skin lines. Letters in information, such as circuit titles and drawing numbers. Hammers guide nails to board in specified locations. Traces lines of diagram and lettering with pen, and brushes shellac preservative on drawing paper. Selects most feasible locations for cable arms and guide nails when location options are specified. Transfers layout board to storage rack, using handtruck.

Title: TRANSFORMER-STOCKROOM MAN
Definition: Receives, stores, and issues transformers used in electric power system: Moves new transformers to storage space, using hoist. Drains oil from used transformers. Starts motor-driven pump which forces used oil through filtering machine and into storage tank. Selects type and size of transformer to fill requisition. Fills oil container of transformers to be issued with new or reclaimed oil. Hoists transformers onto truck for delivery keeps stock records.

Title: FOREMAN, CLAY PREPARATION
Definition: foreman, mad room. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in production of casting slip and plastic clay, used in forming pottery and porcelain ware: Directs in blending, mixing, filtering, and pugging clay. Inspects slip and plastic clay for specified composition, weight, specific gravity, and plasticity. Sets up and adjusts mixing and screen machines, filter presses, pug mills, pumps, and storage tanks. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: SUGAR-PROCESSING-EQUIPMENT TENDER
Definition: Dorr operator. Tends diffusing, purifying, or separating equipment that processes beets or cane into sugar: Turns valve to regulate flow of liquid to or from process or storage tanks. Turns dial to maintain specified temperature of liquid. Adds specified amount of chemical agents used to facilitate sugar refining process. Notifies supervision of any equipment malfunction.

Title: SERVICEMAN, OIL WELL
Definition: oil-well-electrical-wall-sampling-device operator; rigman, electric well-service; sample-taker operator. Obtains sample of earth formations in side walls of oil well boreholes, using electrically exploding device: Loads explosives into gun chambers of tubular firing device. Connects gun chambers to electric detonating cable, using handtools. Signals HOIST OPERATOR to lower sample-taking gun into well. Observes wire line measuring device, weight indicator, and instrument panel of control equipment in truck to position sample- taking gun at specified point in well. Moves controls to set off electrical igniters that fire cylinders into side wall of rock formation to obtain sample of earth. Signals HOIST OPERATOR to raise equipment and sample from well. May be required to have license for handling explosives. May operate hoist to lower and raise tools and equipment from well.

Title: MARINE OILER
Definition: motorman ;oiler ; striker. Oils and greases moving parts, such as gears, shafts, and bearings, or engines and auxiliary equipment used to propel maritime vessels: Examines machinery for specified pressure and flow of lubricants. Fills oil cups on machinery with grease and lubricating oil, according to machinery lubrication instructions. Reads pressure and temperature gages and records data in engineering log. Assists ENGINEER in overhauling and adjusting machinery. May lubricate deck machinery when vessel is unloading cargo.

Title: BONER, MEAT
Definition: ribber. Cuts bones from standard cuts of meat such as chucks, hams, loins, plates, rounds, and shanks, to prepare them for packing and marketing, using knife and meathook: Inserts knife in meat around bones to separate meat, fat, or tissue. Pulls and twists bones loose from meat. Cuts and trims such meat cuts as butts, hams, flanks, and shoulders to shape them and remove fat and defects. Trims meat from bones and ribs. May pull bones and skin from cooked pigs feet and cut out toe bones and nails. May be designated according to cut of meat boned as BLADE BONER; CHUCK BONER; HAM BONER; or type of animal boned as BEEP BONER; HOG RIBBER; SHEEP BONER.see volume II for additional titles.

Title: DAGGER, OUTSIDE
Definition: Sprays dag (conductive coating) on outer surface of television picture tubes, using spray gun: Selects masking shield, according to size and type of tube, and places on tube. Squeezes spray gun trigger to apply coating to tube and removes shield. Brushes or sprays sealant around base of tubes. Cleans shields, using solvent and cloths.

Title: EQUIPMENT-SERVICE SUPERVISOR
Definition: lead fooler. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in servicing airplanes with fuel, lubricant, and coolants on flight line of airport. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: HOUSE MOTHER
Definition: cottage parent. Acts as house manager, adviser, and chaperon for boarding school, college fraternity or sorority house, children's home, or similar establishment: Hires housekeeping personnel and assigns duties. Orders supplies, plans menus, and determines need for maintenance, repairs, and furnishings. Assigns rooms, assists in planning recreational activities, and supervises work and study programs. Compiles records of daily activities of members. Chaperons group-sponsored trips and social functions. Ascertains need for and secures services of PHYSICIAN (medical ser.). Answers telephone and sorts and distributes mail. May escort individuals on trips outside establishment for shopping or to obtain medical or dental services.

Title: PARACHUTE MARKER
Definition: Folds rectangular signal-flare parachutes in four and marks corner, representing center of parachute, with pencil prior to further processing.

Title: CONCILIATOR
Definition: arbitrator Negotiates with company officials on labor disputes: Confers with union members and prepares cases for presentation. Meets with employers to negotiate or arbitrate. Reports decisions reached or outcome of negotiations to union members. May call on members to testify during conferences between management and union. May personally appear before government bodies to represent union in cases involving disputes.

Title: PIPE-LINE WORKER
Definition: Bolts together sections of pipe for use in oil, gas, or steam systems, working as member of team: Places flange and rubber gasket over each adjoining section and interposes metal tube with flared ends between rubber gaskets, fitting it over ends of adjoining pipes. Bolts flanges together and tightens with wrench, producing Joint. Pours sealing compounds over joint and wraps it with asbestos covering to prevent corrosion and leakage. PIPE-

Title: CYLINDER BATCHER
Definition: batcher. Tends machine that draws doth through softening solution and winds it onto perforated cylinder to prepare it for dyeing.

Title: CHAUFFEUR, FUNERAL CAR
Definition: funeral driver. Drives mortuary vehicles, such as hearses and limousines: Drives hearse to transport bodies to mortuary for embalming and from mortuary to piece of funeral service or interment. Helps PALLBEARERS to move casket from mortuary into hearse and from hearse to destination. Arranges flowers in hearse. Drives limousine in funeral procession, following prearranged schedule, to transport mourners. Assists passengers entering or leaving limousine. May clean vehicles prior to funeral. May dust furniture and sweep floors in mortuary. May be designated according to type of vehicle driven as FUNERAL- LIMOUSINE DRIVER; HEARSE DRIVER.

Title: ELECTRIC-MOTOR ANALYST
Definition: tear-down man. Determines causes of failures in electric motors, following drawings and specifications and using handtools and electrical test meters: Dismantles motor, using handtools. E Examines bearings, brackets, and other parts for wear and damage. Tests armature and stator for shorted, grounded, or broken wires, using electrical test meters. Lists causes of motor failures and repairs required and reports them to repairman. May repair mechanical parts and reassemble motor, using hand- tools and power tools. May rebuild motor.

Title: ETCHER, HAND
Definition: Etches trademarks on stainless steel knives and forks, using rubber stamp and add solution: Ties cloth around glass block and pours acid on cloth to form stamp pad. Places cutlery in lime bath. Removes cutlery from bath, presses rubber stamp on acid pad, and stamps cutlery.

Title: FURNACEMAN HELPER
Definition: Assists FURNACEMAN to install gas burner units in furnaces to convert furnaces from wood, coal, or oil to gas: Removes old grates or heating unit from furnace, using handtools. Cleans soot and fly ash from inside furnace and pipes preparatory to installation of gas burner unit, using vacuum cleaner, brush, and shovel. Tests pipe joints for leaks, using soapsuds. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: SOLICITOR
Definition: canvasser; salesman, house-to-house; salesman, outside. Solicits business for establishment by calling door to door, following leads from management, other workers, or from listings in city and telephone directories: Explains services rendered or product sold by business establishment. Writes and gives orders to establishment manager for filling by another worker. May distribute advertising literature explaining services or products or leave samples.

Title: SHOE CLEANER
Definition: shoe polisher; freer. Removes foreign matter, such as grease and cement, from finished shoes, using art gum, knife, and cleaning fluids. May apply dressing to cleaned area to restore color and finish. May wrap shoe ornaments with paper for protection during packing and shipping. May he designated according to material cleaned as SUEDE CLEANER; WHITE-SHOE CLEANER; or according to part cleaned as BOTTOM CLEANER; LINING CLEANER; STITCH CLEANER.

Title: ACTUARY
Definition: Applies knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, principles of finance and business to problems in life, health, social, and casualty insurance, annuities, and pensions: Determines mortality, accident, sickness, disability, and retirement rates; constructs probability tables regarding fire, natural disasters, and unemployment, based on analysis of statistical data and other pertinent information. Designs insurance and pensions plans and calculates premiums. Ascertains premium rates required and cash reserves and liabilities necessary to ensure payment of future benefits. Determines equitable basis for distributing surplus earnings under participating insurance and annuity contracts in mutual companies. May specialize in one type of insurance and be designated as ACTUARY, CASUALTY; ACTUARY, LITE.

Title: PETROLEUM ENGINEER
Definition: Devises methods to improve oil or gas well production and determines need for new or modified tool designs: Studies geological surveys, earth samples, and other data and advises on type of derrick and drilling equipment to be used for drilling new or reworking old wells. Oversees drilling operations and offers technical advice to achieve economical and satisfactory progress. Directs testing of boreholes to determine pressures, temperatures, direction of drilling, strata encountered, and other factors. Recommends and oversees use of drilling mud and casing cement, and directs gun perforating, squeeze cementing, and other special techniques and tools to solve drilling problems. Devises methods for bringing wells into production and controlling flow of oil or gas and for reestablishing flow by artificial means after natural flow has ceased. Recommends procedures for treating oil to remove sediment and water. Oversees maintenance and cleaning of producing wells. Determines gas-oil ratios of producing wells anddsignates allowable flow of oil or gas to meet proration regulations. Compiles logs for each well, production records on flowing wells, and other data. Prepares regular engineering reports and conducts special studies on subjects, such as salt-water encroachment and operating equipment. May conduct geological and geophysical surveys (GEOLOGIST, PETROLEUM]. May be designated GAS ENGINEER if worker is concerned only with natural- gas production. Engineers concerned with the refining of petroleum should be classified as CHEMICAL ENGINEERS (profess. & kin.).

Title: LOADER HELPER
Definition: 922-887.Assists LOADER I in loading and unloading liquid chemicals, petroleum products, and other liquids into or from tank cars, trucks, or barges, performing any combination of the following duties: Cleans tanks, using brooms, hose, and cleaning compound. Removes and replaces dome caps, using wrenches. Connects hose to outlet plugs at bottom of tank to prepare car for unloading. Disconnects hoseand replaces plugs after unloading, using wrenches. Performs other duties as described under HELPER.

Title: BATCH-PLANT OPERATOR
Definition: aggregate weigher; batcherman ; hopper man; mix weigher: scaleman. Tends permanent or portable batcher plant to weigh concrete aggregates: Adjusts scales for required weights of sand, gravel, and cement. Pulls levers to admit concrete aggregates separately from storage hoppers to weighing bins. Observes indicators that show when specified amounts of aggregates have been weighed. Opens valve to admit water into revolving drum of transit-mix truck. Pulls lever to discharge dry aggregates from weighing bin into carriers, such as batch truck and transit-mix truck. May measure aggregates by volume instead of by weight.

Title: ACID BOTTLER
Definition: acid-bottling-machine operator. Tends machine equipped with volume control (measuring device) and heat-sealing unit to fill polyethylene bottles with add solutions for dry- charge batteries: Adjusts volume control for quantity specified on work order. Pulls lever to fill first bottle and measures contents, using gage to detect malfunction of control. Fits cap over top of filled bottle and attaches beat sealer to seal cap. Dips bottles into water tank to rinse off add. Applies colored stripes to bottle with gun to identify volume and concentration of add in bottle. May fill and paste labels on lass bottles.

Title: BLUE-PANCIL MAN
Definition: depoter, okay Man. Determines style and size of standard pattarns and any variations to be used in catting out made to-measure clothing: Prepares work order ticket, using notations made on ticket by retail establishment worker who recorded customer's measurements and style and fabric preferences. Designates standard patterns to be used in cutting out each article of clothing. Makes notations on ticket to indicate to MARKER (any ind.) any variations from standard patterns necessary to fit individual customer.

Title: DRY-PAN CHARGER
Definition: dry-pan feeder. Transports, mixes, and charges specified quantities of day into dry-pan hoppers, using overhead crane, equipped with clamshell or lift-scoop tractor: Reads production schedule to determine proportions of various clays needed for scheduled products. Transports specified amounts of clays from storage plies to mixing area and mixes clay by filling clamshell or scoop with clay and dumping day back on pile. Transports mixed day to dry pan and charges it into hoppers. Lubricates equipment, using grease gun and oil can.

Title: BALANCER, SCALE
Definition: Adjusts mechanisms and repairs or replaces defective parts to insure balance and accuracy of scales: Rolls test weights to and from position on scale platform and reads dial indications or weight tickets if scale is so equipped to verify accuracy of scales. Determines type of error, and coordinates readings with weights by adjusting parts, such as loading box, rack, pendulum weights, and cams for travel and leverage. Adjusts and tightens parts, such as locking handle, cam holddowns and ribbons, pendulum lever assembly, and stops for tare-beam lever, using handtools. Reduces friction to minimum in all bearings and parts of scale, using chisels, taps, tin snips, hacksaw, plumb bob, and electric drill. Repairs or replaces defective parts. May install parts in conjunction with balancing operation. May be designated according to type of scale balanced as SCALE BALANCER, CYLINDER; SCALE BALANCER, FAN; SCALE BALANCES, PROJECTED INDICATION; and according to use as SCALE BALANCER, INDUSTRIAL; and SCALE BALANCER, RETAIL.

Title: FORMER, HAND
Definition: Bends and straightens cold and hot metal plates, bars, structural shapes, and weldments to angles, curves, or flanges as aped fled by drawings, layouts, and templates, using form blocks, fixtures, forming bars, sledge, power hammer, and portable grinders: Lays out reference points onto workpieces and form blocks, using tape, compass, and radius bar, and applying knowledge of geometry, effects of heat, and physical properties of metal. Sets up and bolts or clamps fixtures, dies, and forming bars to form Mock to outline specified contour. Heats metal, using furnace or hand torch. Lifts, positions, alines, and damps or bolts workplece to form block of fixture, using tongs or hoist. Bends workplece, using bar or by hammering with sledge or mallet. Straightens out warps or bumps by hammering against face block or by heating with hand torch. Clips and grinds edges to specified contour, using chipping hammer and portable and stand grinder. May operate hand-powered machines such as roll, brake, or bender. May bedesignated by product formed as TOOL BENDER, HAND.

Title: FOREMAN, THRESHING DEPARTMENT
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers in threshing department of tobacco processing plant: Pushes buttons on control panels to start conveyors and machines. Observes threshing machine units to detect jams and defective machine operations. Removes clogged tobacco, using metal rod or hand, or diverts flow of tobacco to another processing line until jams have been corrected. Feels tobacco to determine moisture content and turns valves to regulate flow of steam and water into ordering machine [ORDERING- MACHINE OPERATOR] Keeps payroll timecards for subordinates. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: CELLOPHANE-FOLDING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that automatically folds edges to reinforce cellophane ribbon: Places preselected spool of ribbon on spindle and threads ribbon through feeding device of machine onto winding spool. Starts machine that automatically folds edges of ribbon to specified width and winds it on spool. Stops machine and straightens or repositions ribbon to prevent Jains.

Title: SPRAY-MACHINE LOADER
Definition: Feeds or off-bears machine, operated by SPRAY- MACHINE OPERATOR, that sprays glaze onto bisque ware. Examines sprayed ware and segregates defective pieces.

Title: CAKE-PRESS-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: Assists CAKE-PRESS OPERATOR in compressing and baking chipped, rolled, or slabbed plastics materials into cake molds for sheeting: Positions empty molds on platform scales. Spreads plastics chips evenly over mold, using spreader. Pushes molds along roller conveyor from baking press to cooling press. Pushes cooled molds from press onto roller conveyor. Removes platen from mold and pushes it along roller conveyor to storage rack. Removes cake from mold and trims flash, using knife. Stacks cakes on pallets. Pushes empty mold along conveyor to scale. Cleans molds and presses, using knife and scraper. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: CHINCHILLA-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: curling-machine operator; whirling-machine operator. Tends machine that curls pile of fabric to simulate natural fur: Positions truck of cloth at feed end of machine. Sews cloth to preceding piece of cloth in machine, using sewing machine. Turns knob to raise or lower curling brushes according to depth of pile. Straightens cloth to remove wrinkles before cloth passes under rotating brushes. Feels curled pile to detect knotting of fibers caused by brushes being out of adjustment. Notifies supervisor when knots are found. Cleans accumulated fibers from brushes, using hook. Ravels seam to separate roll at end of piece. Pulls or lifts roll onto truck.

Title: TRUCK ESCORT
Definition: Accompanies drivers of trucks delivering materials to an industrial establishment to direct them to destination.

Title: STOVE TENDER
Definition: hot-blaster man. Operates battery of gas-fired stoves to supply heated airblast to blast furnace: Turns gas valves and ignites burners is combustion chamber of stove, using torch. Observe temperature records, and moves controls to close m and chimney valves when heat inside stove reaches specified temperature. Opens valves on stove allowing air from blowing engine to pass through hot-blast stem into furnace. Adjusts stove controls to maintain specified temperature of airblast. A lternates operation amour stoves in battery to provide continuous blast of hot air Cleans carbon and dirt from flues to prevent interns, explosions. Inspects cooling and washing equipment for leaks. Assists furnace crew in casting hot mete, and flushing slag from furnace.

Title: DECORATOR
Definition: fancy man. Molds and decorates ice cream confections according to order: Packs ice cream into metal molds shaped as flowers, fruit, animals, cake, or pie, using spoon, knife, or spatula. Presses mold halves together and places mold in hardening cabinet. Immerses hardened molds in water, pries them open and removes confection, using knife. Whips cream, sugar, and dye by hand or in machine beater to make whipped cream of specified color and consistency. Folds parchment paper into cone shape, places required metal extrusion tip into bottom of cone and fills it with whipped cream. Presses tube and moves it over confection to create designs and figures, such as leaves, flowers, wreaths, or letters, to decorate confection as indicated on order. Holds confection under stencil in tray and covers confection with whipped cream, using spatula, or with dye to form wording, using spray gun. May place paper, plastic or metal decorations on confection.

Title: GREASER
Definition: Lubricates and greases tractors and other powered term machinery and attachments, fills gasoline tanks and radiators, changes and inflates tires, repairs tubes, couples attachments, such as cultivators and stalk cutter to tractors, and adjusts attachments to till soil at prescribed depth or to operate otherwise in an efficient manner.

Title: GOLF-CLUB FACER
Definition: facer. Shapes faces of golf club woods to achieve specified contours, using one of following methods: (1) Clamps head of golf club wood in vise and selects file of tooth size, according to amount of material to be removed. Files contours on face. (2) Moves wood head against belt sander to shape face to specified contours. Places serrated cutters and spacers on arbor of motor in specified pattern to set up scoring apparatus. Starts motor and presses face of club into cutters to score face. Measures loft of club with protractor and visually compares faced club with prototype to verify contours.

Title: RACKER
Definition: Clamps arrows in rack preparatory to dipping: Alines arrows in row, slides one end into rack slot, builds successive layers by separating rows with dividers until rack is filled. Clamps ends in rack to hold them securely. Removes dividers and transfers loaded rack to painting department. Keeps records of arrows racked.

Title: FOLDER, HAND
Definition: Envelope folder; hand folder: table worker. Folds, gums, and finishes by hand die- cut blanks to make envelopes: Scores blank, using spatula or scoring tool. Folds envelope blanks according to pattern and creases folds by hand or with spatula. Applies gum to edges of flaps with brush or stick and seals flaps before gum dries. Applies gum to open flap with stick and allows it to dry. Folds down open flaps and packs completed envelopes in specified boxes. May tend machines that affix clasps, reinforcing patches, snap fasteners, and string or wire ties to envelopes [MACHINE OPERATOR, GENERAL]. May attach cellophane strips or other decorations to envelopes by hand FOLDER INSPECTOR (carpet & rug; house furn : tex. bag; textile)see INSPECTOR.

Title: TIMBER PACKER
Definition: Loads logs or sawed lumber onto flatcars, trucks, and boats, packing them tightly and securing load with stakes, chains, and cables so that load will not shift in transit.

Title: SCRAP BALLER
Definition: Tends machine that winds metal scrap into balls for salvage: Hooks end of scrap onto reel of machine, using hook or hand tool. Starts machine that rotates reel and winds scrap into ball of specified size. Turns lever to eject wound ball from machine. Signals ELECTRIC-BRIDGE-OR-QANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to lower sling, and hooks ball onto sling for removal from work area. May tie ball with wire to prevent unraveling. May grade scrap according to alloy oontent. May turn reel by hand to wind scrap.

Title: SOLDER MAKER
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in refining scrap solder and tin and lead alloy with refined scrap to make solder: Directs workers in weighing tin, lead, and scrap solder and in refining operations. Molds and weighs test piece to compute ratio of tin and lead in refined metal. Computes amounts of tin, lead, and refined solder to be used in making solder according to formula. Directs workers in melting and mixing metals in melting pot, molding solder, cutting bars to specified lengths, weighing, recording weights, and packing. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: BURNING FOREMAN
Definition: brick burner, head. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in controlling field, periodic, retort, and tunnel kilns to bake green day products, such as brick, tile, and sewer pipe. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: KNURLING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that knurls wire coil preparatory to making nails: Places coil on feed reel of machine. Threads wire between knurling rolls which roughen surface of wire, and onto winding spool. Starts machine. Removes spool when gage indicates specified length of wire has been knurled.

Title: FLEECE TIER
Definition: Folds and ties each wool fleece into bundle: Removes heavy tags, dung locks, and badly stained wool from fleece. Spreads fleece on floor with hide side up. Folds loose ends inside and rolls fleece into compact bundle, tying it with twisted wool or paper twine. Tosses bundle aside for sacking or grading. May shear sheep [SHEEP SHEARER).

Title: FASTENER-AUTOMATION-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates machine to process chain of slide fastener (ripper): Threads ends of continuous chain through guides, rollers, spray and steam units, brushes, and counter. Turns nuts, screws, valves, and wheels to adjust tension of chain, pressure of rollers, and to regulate spraying or heating action, using wrenches and screwdriver. Starts machine that automatically deburrs metal scoops beneath rotating wire brushes, closes fastener by meshing scoops of both stringers in ripper (closing device), rolls chain to uniform thickness, steams and presses tape to iron out wrinkles, prints directional arrow on edge of tape, sprays chain with lacquer or wax to waterproof and improve appearance, counts and measures scoops and chain, and inspects chain electronically for defects, such as missing, cracked, smashed, broken, low or high scoops, and uneven spacing. Replaces cartons at feeder and discharge ends of machine and refills reservoirs with lacquer and wax.

Title: COLOR MATCHER
Definition: heel sprayer, firat; uniformer. Inspects shoes for color uniformity and rectifies defects: Examines outer surface of finished shoes for spots of light or irregular coloring. Mixes coloring solutions until matching color is obtained. Sprays solution on defective area of shoe with spray gun or applies by hand, using rag or finger. Polishes repaired area with rag to blend with other shoe surface.

Title: LOFTSMAN, PILE DRIVING
Definition: stick- man; tlberman; lop man, pile driving. Climbs leads or ladder to aline wood, steel, or concrete piles in piledriver leads and remove pile line: Wraps chain or cable around woodpile and leads to prevent buckling while driving. Places pad on pile head and signals PILE-DRIVER OPERATOR to lower hammer for driving. Climbs ladder or rides crane hook to top of sheet steel piles. Straddles pile to guide and interlock edges of adjacent piles. Signals PILE-DRIVER OPERATOR to raise, swing, lower, and release each pile, and to hoist, position, start, and stop piledriver. May cut off damaged parts of steel sheet pile, using oxyacetylene cutting torch. May guide Jet pipe to assist PILE-DRIVING NOZZLEMAN. May cut, shape, and install timber and planks to build wharves, docks, and shoring.

Title: LATHE SPOTTER
Definition: block hanger; lathe charger; log swinger. Controls hoist to position log on rotary lathe preparatory to peeling veneer: Selects chucks according to size of log to be peeled and installs chuck on spindle of rotary lathe. Attaches hoist hooks to ends of log and pushes button or pulls chain to lift log into position between spindle chucks. Alines log between spindle chucks and signals VENEER-LATHE OPERATOR (basketry; veneer & plywood) to insert spindle chucks into log. Removes hoist hooks from log. Removes log from lathe after veneer has been peeled. May record size and number of logs fed to lathe, using calibrated stick to measure log.

Title: PAPER MAN
Definition: 652487.stockman. Strips outside wrapper from rolls of wallpaper stock and outs away torn, soiled, or creased sections, using knife, to prepare stock for printing. Transfers stock to printing machines, using hand truck.

Title: DAUBER-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends dauber machine that fastens swab daubers to wires attached to cork stoppers: Inserts booked wires through center of corks and positions them into slots on edge of revolving wheel of machine. Starts machine that automatically fastens swabs to wires attached to corks. Removes finished products from slots, if not automatically ejected, and places them in containers. Moves filled containers to storage area, using band truck.

Title: SKIVER
Definition: Tends machine that bevels edges of leather parts of articles, such as belting, gloves, and handbags to prepare parts for joining: Turns set- screws to adjust gage, guide, feed roller, and blade to regulate angle of bevel. Depresses pedal to start machine. Positions part on bed of machine against gage and beneath guide. Guides part over feed roller that forces edge of material against blade to skive edge. Sharpens blade, using emery wheel. May manually pull leather strips across fixed cutting edge to reduce thickness and be designated SKIVER, HAND.

Title: BOAT-LOADER HELPER
Definition: 922J87.dock helper; dock man helper; wharf helper; wharf- tender helper. Connects hoses to transfer liquid cargo, such as petroleum, gasoline, heating oil, sulfuric acid, and alum liquor, from and into barges and tankers: Catches mooring hawsers and ties them around dock posts to secure vessels. Couples hoses to valves on ships' tanks and turns handwheels to open or close valves. Removes lines from vessels and casts off hawsers. Drains loading hoses and places them on dollies. Cleans oil and waste materials from dock, using squeegees, broom, and rags. May be designated according to vessels loaded as BARGE-LOADER HELPER.

Title: COILER
Definition: blocker; coiler operator; slitting- machine coiler. Tends coiler that winds metal strips, sheets, or wire into coils as they emerge from rolling mills, slitters, or other machines: Adjusts coiler guides and rollers according to size of work-piece, using handtools. Starts machine which automatically winds metal onto reels and observes operation to prevent lams, uneven winding, or wrinkles. Regulates tension of coiler to prevent tearing or stretching of metal Inspects surface of metal for stains, dirt, scratches, and other defects. Binds finished coils to prevent uncoiling. May move controls to activate hydraulic pusher arm and tilt table to transfer coil onto skid or conveyor. May be designated by employer according to particular type or trade name of machine tended or product coiled.

Title: HORSE BREAKER, SADDLE
Definition: trainer. Trains young horses to bridle and saddle: Gains confidence of animal by feeding it and talking to it. Puts saddle and bridle on animal, enclosed in small pen, and mounts it. Rides horse to open area or corral and teaches it to respond to bridle and spurs. Does not break wild horses, as opposed to COWPUNCHER.

Title: SEAMER MECHANIC
Definition: closing- machine repairman. Repairs and maintains automatic can-closing or seaming machines, using handtools and testing instruments: Disassembles machine and cleans, oils, and replaces worn parts. Changes and adjusts fixtures to accommodate containers of various sizes. Tests machine and examines seams on cans for defects. May supervise and instruct machine operators.

Title: POWDERMAN
Definition: Screens, melts, and pours TNT into projectile cases: Poors TNT powder into hopper of screening machine which reduces lumps by agitation. Pours powder into revolving steam- heated kettle and adjusts controls to permit steam to flow in pipes around kettle, heating and melting TNT. Empties melted explosive into buckets through valves. Tests temperature of TNT with thermometer and cools it to prescribed temperature, using power-operated paddle. Pours molten TNT into shell and bomb cases. Breaks off crystallized TNT scrap and returns it to melting pot. Drills threaded holes in charge into which boosters are loaded. Loads shells and bombs with TNT powder, pouring explosive into cases by hand and pressing powder down with hydraulic press.

Title: SPRING FORMER, HAND
Definition: fitter, hand. Shapes semielliptical spring leaves, using hand forming-jack: Heads specifications to determine arch required to shape leaf and computes additional arch required to compensate for unsetting of leaves in subsequent operations. Positions forming die (flexible pattern) over center pin of jack. Bends pattern and secures it to jack with holding pin. Positions center hole of hot leaf over center pin and bends leaf, using clamp tongs. Clamps ends of each leaf to pattern and sprinkles water over loaf to set arch and prevent warping. Quenches leaves in oil and places them in tempering oven [TEMPERER (heat treat.)]. Shapes cold leaves on fitting block with sledge hammer.

Title: SOLE SORTER
Definition: Insole or oaf sole sorter; insole sorter; stock sorter, sole. Sorts and grades leather soles: Sorts right and left insoles or outsoles into groups. Examines groups for defects, such as nicks, scars, brittleness, and texture, to grade soles. Records information on grading sheet. Bundles soles or places them in containers for discard, reprocessing, shipment, or storage.

Title: SLOT WEDGER
Definition: armature dipper; slipper. Slides wood or fiber wedges into ends of armature core slots or feeds machine which automatically inserts wedges to hold coils in place: Cuts coil leads to prescribed length, using pliers, and bends them to lie in specified core slots. Places fiber drift lengthwise in each slot and taps with hammer to compress coils. Inserts wood or fiber wedge into end of core slot and pushes into place, using special pliers or hammer, or mounts armature in machine which automatically inserts wedges as armature turns in machine.

Title: TERRAZZO-TILE MAKER
Definition: Molds pulverized marble, metallic oxides or pigment, cement, and water in specific pattern to form terrazzo tile: Mixes colored marble and metallic oxides with cement and water to prepare molding mixture. Inserts pattern in mold and applies layer of colored mixture over surface in sections of pattern to form design of tile fare. Removes pattern and sprinkles mixture of dry cement and sand on mold to absorb moisture. Fills remainder of mold with wet cement and sand to form tile backing. Draws straightedge across top of mold to remove excess cement. Places block on mold and compresses tile in hydraulic press to obtain smooth surface on tile face. Removes mold from press and separates tile from die. May coat surface of die with oil to prevent tile from adhering to die.

Title: TUBE SIZER-AND-CUTTER OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machines that die-size and cut paper tubes to specified diameter and lengths preparatory to processing into BB shot containers: Installs and adjusts sizing arbors, dies, cutting rolls, and spacing of pickup fingers, using screwdrivers and wrenches. Starts and observes machines for malfunction. Clears Jams and removes scrap paper, using fingers or knife. Measures inside and outside diameters of tubes, using fixed gages.

Title: CLOCK OPERATOR, TOBACCO AUCTION
Definition: Starts and stops dock at tobacco auction that registers bid prices for each lot of tobacco: Sets hand at starting price specified by auction officials for each lot of tobacco. Pushes button to start sweep hand rotating on command. Stops clock at completion of sale.

Title: FILLER
Definition: Fills cavities in exterior surface of corncob pipe bowls with plaster of paris: Mixes plaster paste and water. Places cob bowl on revolving spindle. Applies plaster to sides and ends of bowl by hand, filling cavities and smoothing exterior surfaces of bowl.

Title: HEARSE UPHOLSTERER
Definition: Upholsters interior of hearse bodies: Selects and cuts material to specifications, using shears and pattern. Sews material together, using sewing machine. Installs padding, and tacks, glues, and sews covering material in place. Attaches specified metal moldings and ornamental braid. May design new patterns. HEART SPECIALIST (medical ser.) tee CARDIOLOGIST. I

Title: INDUSTRIAL-ILLUMINATING ENGINEER
Definition: Determines quality and quantity of illumination required to aid in acheiving maximum production, minimum waste, and accident prevention in industrial plants: Studies lighting requirements of overall processes as well as individual jobs, and designs equipment which will direct light at specific angles to work areas, aid in performance of critical operations, disclose flaws and imperfections in work, and eliminate glare and shadows.

Title: SMOKER
Definition: meat smoker; smokehouse attendant; smokehouse man. Controls battery of smoke chambers in which meats, such as bacon, hams, meat loaf, sausage, shoulders, and wieners, are cooked and cured: Loads racks and cages, suspended from overhead conveyor, with meat products and filled molds, and pushes racks into smokehouse for cooking and curing. Shovels sawdust into hopper of smoker and lights burner to ignite sawdust. Starts electric blower to admit air and blow smoke into curing chambers. Observes gages, turns steam valves, and adjusts ventilators and dampers to regulate temperature, humidity, and density of smoke to control cooking and curing process. Inspects meat for color, feels it for firmness, and inserts thermometer Into meat to ascertain progress of cooking and curing. Opens water valve to spray and chill meat. Removes cooked and cured meat and empties molds. Places meat loaves on racks and returns them to smokehouse for further smoking and drying. Pushes racks of cured meat to chill room. May stuff meat loaves into plastic casings, using horn (funnel- shaped tube). May record weight and amount of meat cured. May steam-clean smoke chambers and beating coils, and remove ash.

Title: FIREMAN, MALT HOUSE
Definition: fireman; kiln fireman. Controls gas-fired furnace that heats malt drying kilns: Pushes ignition switch and turns gas valve to light furnace. Observes temperature gage or recording charts, and adjusts gas valves, dampers, and speeds of draft and exhaust fans to maintain specified temperature in kiln. May move levers that tip floor sections of kiln to drop dried malt into storage hopper. May open and control slide gate of storage hopper dispensing malt to cleaning machine. FIREMAN, MARINE (water trans.) . Tends boilers aboard vessel to maintain steam at specified pressure: Installs atomizing tips on end of burner barrels with wrench. Inserts barrels in burners. Connects fuel-oil lines to burners. Ignites fuel with torch. Adjusts burners to win within steam-treasure at specified level. Cleans drip pans, atomising tips, burner barrels, and work area, using steam connections, solvent, or rags. Must havecertificate issued by U.S. Coast Guard. May operate soot-blowers to clean combustion residue on generating tubes. May regulate amount of water in boiler and be known as FIREMAN-WATERTENDER.

Title: SHEEP RANCHER
Definition: sheep farmer. Breeds and raises sheep for production of wool, meat, and breeding stock: Provides pasture, range, and crop land to graze and produce feed for livestock. Selects and purchases livestock, equipment, and supplies. Determines time for sheep to be placed on range for grazing, time for breeding, and type and amount of supplemental feeding required to produce maximum wool and meat. Provides water for animals. Arranges for and directs workers engaged in lambing, docking (cutting off tails), shearing, dipping (disinfecting animals), selecting animals for market or breeding, and other phases of sheep raising. Insures adherence to State health and grazing regulations for animals. Hires and discharges workers. Markets animals and wool. Maintains breeding, production, cost, and other records. May groom and exhibit show animals.

Title: TURRET-LATHE SET-UP OPERATOR, TOOL
Definition: Sets up and operates turret lathe to perform series of machining operations, such as turning, facing, boring, and tapping, on metal work pieces, such as machine, tool, or die parts, analyzing specifications and deciding on tooling according to knowledge of machining operations: Studies blueprint to visualize machining to be done, and plans sequence of operations. Selects method of holding work piece. Positions and secures work piece to faceplate or in chuck jaws, collet, or holding fixture, using wrenches. Selects cutting speed, tool feed rate, depth of cut, and cutting tools for each operation, according to knowledge of metal properties and shop mathematics. Positions and secures tools in tool- holders at each station of turret and cross-slide tool post, and positions tools in relation to work piece. Moves stops, cams or levers to control rotation of work piece and feeding of tools. Turns hand wheels to feed tools to and along work piece and to index tool holders between operations, or engages feeding andidexing mechanisms. Verifies conformance of machined work piece to specifications, using measuring instruments, such as gages, calipers, and micrometer. May set up work holding fixtures. May sharpen tools with bench grinder. May turn valve handle and direct flow of coolant against tool and work piece. May operate tracing attachment to duplicate profile of template or model on work piece. May work on nonmetallic materials, such as plastics. May be required to have specialized experience with particular material, product, precision level, machining process or size, type, or trade name of lathe. May be designated according to whether lathe is primarily equipped to machine bar stock fed through head stock of screw machine as SCREW-MACHINE SET- UP OPERATOR, TOOL; or work pieces held in chuck (chucking machine) as CHUCKING -MACHINE SET -UP OPERATOR, TOOL. May be designated according to type of lathe as TURRET- LATHE SET- UP OPERATOR, TOOL, VERTICAL.

Title: FILTERMAN
Definition: Operates filter machine to separate contaminants from cornstarch, and controls temperature and specific gravity of starch suspension fed to filters: Turns valves to admit water to dilute starch suspension in standardization tank until hydrometer indicates specific gravity of solution conforms to specifications. Starts pumps and turns valves to transfer starch suspension between filter and tanks, and to regulate flow of wash water to filter spray nozzle. Reads thermometers and turns steam valves to heat tank coils and maintain specified temperature of water. Assists in changing filter cloths, and repairs or replaces broken filter strings. May flush soiled filter cloths, using hose. May insert wires into filter nozzles to clear clogging. May standardize starch suspensions in batch tanks after filtering [BREAKER MAN].Filter man (distilled liquors; glue; malt liquors)see FILTER WASHER AND PRESSER.

Title: SOAKER
Definition: shrinker; woolen-suiting shrinker. Tends shrinking equipment that preshrinks rolls of woolen suiting: Opens valves to drain condensed steam from soaking tanks preparatory to insertion of rolls. Lifts rolls of suiting into tanks, using chain hoist. Pulls perforated steam pipe down into each roll. Closes door, tightens wingnuts that hold door closed, and opens valves to admit steam into pipes. Shuts off steam and raises pipes at end of specified interval during which steam has permeated, shrunk, and dried suiting.

Title: RESISTOR ASSEMBLER
Definition: coil-unit assembler, helix. Assembles helix (spirally formed) resistance coils into units for use in controlling speed of electrically operated machinery and equipment: Spreads and seats helix coil over metal pins on assembly plate, fits together and cements asbestos strips, cores, dividers, plastic strips, and spacers to form resistor coil assembly. Fits insulators and center plate in coil, and bolts on end plates to secure coll assembly. Alines and bolts specified quantity and type of helix coil assemblies to support frame as specified to form control unit. Insulates coil assemblies from support frame by slipping insulation tubing over bolts. Cuts jumper wires to length with wire cutter and bends jumper wires to fit coil assemblies, using hammer and vise. Moves control unit to storage area, using electric crane. May wind helix coils.

Title: FRAME FEEDER
Definition: machine man. Positions gelatin-drying frames on conveyor below gelatin-spreading machine to receive sheets of congealed gelatin discharged by machine. Slides loaded frame to elevator which stacks frames on truck. Pushes loaded truck to drying alley.

Title: SHEEP SHEARER
Definition: sheep dipper; stock dipper; wool shearer. Shears wool from live sheep, using power-driven clippers or hand shears: Places animal in shearing station. Clips wool close to hide so that fleece is removed in one piece and exercises care to nick or cut skin as little as possible. Herds shorn animal into runway leading to pen. Oils and sharpens clippers and shears. May tie fleece [FLEECE TIER].

Title: ROLL GRINDER
Definition: roll-contour grinder. Sets up and operates portable electric grinder to resurface damaged or worn mill rolls used to compress reclaim rubber into slabs: Positions and bolts grinder to holding fixture beside mill. Examines sample slab from mill to determine extent of grinding necessary to resurface rolls. Selects and bolts grinding wheel to grinder, and turns setscrews to aline it with roll. Starts grinder and turns travel screw to feed rotating grinding wheel horizontally along roll. Repeats grinding until ROLL-GRINDING INSPECTOR confirms that sample slabs are compressed according to standards. Turns adjustment wheel to close rolls of mill, and spreads abrasive compound over ground area of rolls. Starts mill to polish roll surfaces. Wipes abrasive compound from polished rolls.

Title: CLARIFIER OPERATOR
Definition: Tends clarifiers and auxiliary equipment to remove suspended matter and color colloids from raw-sugar liquor: Turns valves to regulate density and temperatures of raw liquors entering blowups, and to balance flow of liquor through units of clarifiers. Records volumetric readings of phosphoric add entering solutions. Turns valves to control steam and airflow to clarifiers. Fills test tube with sample of raw liquor, seals test tube and spins in centrifugal device for analysis. May tend filter press to polish clarifer effluent. May boil equipment in acid to remove scale.

Title: FURNACE-AND-WASH-EQUIPMENT  OPERATOR
Definition: continuous-washer operator. Tends equipment that tumbles metal cartridge parts in acid and detergent solutions to remove oil, scale, and dirt, and dries them: Loads parts into hopper by hand or using hoist. Moves switches to start conveyor system and rotate open end tumbling barrels. Turns steam and water valves and reads gages to regulate temperature and level of liquids in tanks and heat in drying drum. Adds chemicals, as directed, to maintain solutions at specified concentrations. Examines parts at ejection chute to determine if they are completely cleaned and dried. May operate electric tier-lift truck to position containers of parts on platform above feed hopper. May tumble parts in metal-drawing (lubricating) solution before drying.

Title: SHROUDER
Definition: bagger. Covers dressed animal carcasses with muslin to protect meat during storage or shipment: Trims ragged edges of flesh from carcass, using knife. Soaks muslin in brine solution and drapes it around suspended carcass. Pins muslin to carcass, using skewers. Slides carcass along conveyor and onto scale, and records weight. Pushes carcass to conveyor leading to storage or shipping areas. May wash carcass, using water hose.

Title: TIMING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: rating-machine operator. Tends electronic timer that verifies accuracy of clock and watch movements: Positions movement in holding fixture of machine that automatically compares test beat with standard and records discrepancies in beat. Records timing error. Routes inaccurate movements to TIMING ADJUSTER for correction.

Title: EDITORIAL WEITER
Definition: Writes comments on topics of current interest to stimulate or mold public opinion in accordance with viewpoints and policies of publication: Prepares assigned or unassigned articles from knowledge of topic and editorial position of publication, supplemented by additional study and research. Submits and discusses copy with EDITOR, EDITORIAL PAGE for approval. May specialize in one or more fields, such as international affairs, fiscal matters, or national or local politics. May participate in conferences of editorial policy committee to recommend topics and position to be taken by publication on specific public issues.

Title: OPTICAL-ELEMENT COATER
Definition: coater; costing-machine operator. Coats optical elements with chemical or metal film to change reflection qualities or to armor surfaces, using electrical metal- evaporating unit: Installs electrically heated filament of metal to be sublimated and condensed, following specifications, using handtools, such as wrenches and pliers. Cleans and dries optical elements, using chemical solution and torch flame. Positions elements in holding fixture in evaporation unit, and places glass vacuum bell over holding fixture, using hoist. Adjusts instrument panel settings to create vacuum and electrically sublimate materials, such as gold, aluminum, titanium, and silicon monoxide, which condense on surface of optical element. Observes color change reflected from element as thickness of coating increases to determine when elements are coated to specifications. Stops vacuum pump and allows unit to cool. Removes elements and tests adherence of coating by applying and removing strips of cellophane tape. Bakes coated elements in electric oven.

Title: BEATER
Definition: Beats quilts with stick to expel air from quilt and distribute filler evenly.

Title: SCHEDULE CLERK
Definition: schedule -desk man. Prepares production schedules on all display advertising material to determine that all items necessary to pries ad, as specified by customer, are present or available: Prepares form showing information, such as advertiser's name, size of ad, date and number of times it is to run, page and position specified. Attaches form to material and sends it to composing room, Keep file of all material returned.

Title: FOREMAN, STITCHING DEPARTMENT
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in operating sewing machines to produce decorative trimming or stitching, such as tucking, shirring, and embroidering: Directs workers in techniques or procedure in sewing new designs. Assigns new designs and materials to workers to insure continuous work flow. Records number of pieces processed by worker for production cost records. May install or change prepunched cardboard tape on battery of automatic embroidery machines. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: CASTING-MACHINE-SERVICE  OPERATOR
Definition: Tends pumps that transfer processing solutions from casting machines to storage tanks, and cleans casting machines, tanks, pumps, and pipelines: Pumps solution from casting machines to storage tanks or into system feeding other casting machines. Opens valves to drain casting machines, tanks, and pipelines. Cleans equipment, using water and airhoses, scrapers, and brushes to remove viscose. Pumps cleaned solution hack into casting machine.

Title: FOREMAN, BIT AND SHANK DEPARTMENT
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in sawing, shaping, and fitting bits and shanks of smoking pipes: Informs workers engaged in sawing operations of changes in style and number of stummels to saw for each style. Determines from production schedule quantity and style of bits to be bent, and number of each style bit needed. Inspects stummels and bits at each work station to insure conformance to company standards. Sets up machines. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: CLOTH-FINISHING-RANGE OPERATOR
Definition: backfiller; finishing-range operator; hot-tenter-entry-end man; starcher-and tenter range feeder; treater. Tends feed-end of range that applies size, starch, water-repellent, wrinkle resistant, or other chemical finishes to cloth, stretches it to specified width, and dries finished doth: Positions truck of folded doth at feed-end of machine or inserts rod through doth roll and pushes roll onto brackets. Sews doth end to leadcloth in machine, using sewing machine. Turns valve to permit flow of finish solution to trough under mangle. Turns handwheels and knobs to control temperature of dry cans and movement of doth through range, and to adjust width and tension guides. Observes doth entering machine to detect flaws, such as boles and torn selvages. Cuts out flaws, using scissors. When back-filling doth with starch, positions doctor at specified angle to scrape excess starch from cloth. Cleans and greases machines. May be designated according to type of finish applied as BACK SIZER (textile); WATERPROOFING-MACHINE OPERATOR (textile).

Title: LAMINATOR
Definition: ironer, E-laminations; plate stacker; stacker. Fits laminations (metal plates in form of letters E and I) on wire coils to build up shell-type transformer cores: Brushes adhesive on leg ends of laminations. Slides E-laminations on con with center legs of Es inside coil, alternately from opposite ends of coil so that leg ends overlap forming spaces between laminations around coil. Inserts I-laminations in spaces where E-laminations do not overlap. Alines laminations, using mallet or hammer. May build up core blocks, using laminating machine. May build up choke cores, positioning bundle of E-laminations on one side of coil, and fitting bundle of (-laminations on other side. May insert cores in plastic or metal cases and solder core leads to pin leads on case.

Title: PRESS OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that joins and perforates adhesive and felt strips to make corn and bunion plasters: Positions adhesive strip over felt strip fed from spools. Inserts ends of strips into machine and depresses starting pedal.

Title: HOOP MAKER, MACHINE
Definition: Operates machines to make barrel hoops from strap steel: Installs and adjusts rollers, punches, and shear plates in hoop-punch-and-coiler machines, using wrenches. Places roll of strap steel on spindle, inserts end in feed rollers, and starts machine. Removes punched and coiled hoops. Alines holes in ends of coiled hoops on shank of rivets in guide slots of riveting machine. Slides hoop with protruding rivets under reciprocating hammer that flattens rivet shanks. Places hoop over mandrel of hoop-flaring machine and moves leg control to expand jaws that flare hoop to conform to shape of barrel. May be designated according to machine operated as HOOP-FLARING-MACHINE OPERATOR; HOOP-PUNCH-AND-COILER OPERATOR; HOOP-RIVRTING- MACHINE OPERATOR.

Title: CAR CLERK, PULLMAN
Definition: pullman dark. Assigns and dispatches sleeping cars to railroad company requesting cars: Keeps record of car movement and where assigned, using train schedules and movement charts. Assigns CONDUCTORS, PULLMAN to trains for trips and notifies them of assignments.

Title: APICULTURIST
Definition: Studies bee culture and breeding: Conducts experiments regarding causes and controls of bee diseases and factors affecting yields of nectar and pollen on various plants utilized by bees. Determines vitamin content of various honeys, and conducts research into various phases of pollination. Improves bee strains, utilising selective breeding by artificial insemination

Title: LATHE SANDER, HAND
Definition: lathe sander. Removes toolmarks and smooths round wooden parts by hand-sanding them as they are rotated on a lathe or vacuum spindle: Positions part between headstock and tailstock of lathe, and closes tailstock against part to hold it in place or places part on rubber cup of vacuum spindle sander. Starts machine and presses sandpaper of specified grade over and around rotating part. Inspects or feels part to ascertain whether surface is smooth. Removes sanded part from machine. May apply wax or other finishes while part is rotating on machine. May be designated according to machine as VACUUM-SPINDLE SANDER (furn.; shaped wood. art.).

Title: SAMPLE TESTER-GRINDER
Definition: Tends crushers, ovens, and screens to test samples of taconite ore: Starts crusher to pulverise ore. Removes ore from crusher and places it in oven to dry. Sends portion of sample to laboratory for chemical analysis. Places sample in vibrator containing magnets and water. Starts vibrator to separate magnetic content of ore from impurities. Drains water from vibrator and weighs magnetic remainder. Pours ore sample through series of vibrating screens of different site openings to separate ore samples. Weighs each site of ore and notifies supervisor of weights and readings. Records number of tests performed.

Title: SOLDERER-AND-SCRAPER
Definition: Solders bead on tip of brass-wind instrument bells, using torch. Inserts mandrel into chuck of lathe and clamps bell onto mandrel. Starts lathe and scrapes off excess solder, using hand scraping tool and emery cloth.

Title: ROADS SUPERVISOR
Definition: Directs construction and maintenance of roads or streets within jurisdiction in conformity with Federal and State standards, accepted principles of design and engineering, and available funds. Addresses meetings of realtors, citizens, members of financial community, and other interested parties to explain plans and activities of department.

Title: FOREMAN, PRODUCTION
Definition: lease foreman; production foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in pumping, gaging, and treating oil from wells within specified oilfield area: Directs workers in operation and adjustment of pump engines, pumps, gages, oil treating units, and control heads (valve devices controlling flow of oil). Inspects work of crews replacing pump rods and casing in wells, treating wells to increase flow or improve quality of oil, and constructing or repairing oilfield equipment and buildings. Designates allowable flow of oil from wells in accordance with proration regulations and agreements. May direct drilling of wells. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: CLARIFIER-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: Assists CLARIFIER OPERATOR in separating mud from alumina liquor and in recovering soda from mud: Turns valves to flush lines. Tunis valves to divert flow of alumina liquor through standby equipment as directed by CLARIFIER OPERATOR. Reads tank gage and records sludge levels of mud settlers and washers. Takes sample of mud sediments and weighs it to determine density. Lubricates valves and adjusts packing glands to prevent leaks, using grease gun and wrench. Cleans screen boxes. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: INGREDIENT SCALER
Definition: assemblyman; batch man; floor man; general assembler; ingredient man; ingredient mixer; scaling man. Measures Ingredients according to formula for bakery, dairy, and confectionery batches: Reads daily production schedules and selects formula cards for desired batches. Weighs dry ingredients on scales or pours liquid ingredients into graduated containers. Places assembled ingredients for each batch with identifying batch number on conveyor or handtruck or dumps batches in mixing bowl or machine. Records number of batches prepared.

Title: GRINDER, HAND
Definition: backside grinder. Grinds approximate curves on lens blanks, using grinding machine: Selects lens blanks specified on production order. Places blank in bolder and positions held lens on diamond lap of grinding machine. Lowers spindle of weighted arm onto lens holder to hold lens on lap. Starts machine and manually moves control arm back and forth to grind lens blanks to such curves as standard curves on back surface of blank. Removes blank from holder and washes blank in water to remove grinding coolant. Measures blanks periodically with lens gage to insure all blanks being ground to same curve.

Title: BRAKE-LINING FINISHER, ASBESTOS
Definition: impregnator operator. Tends tanks that impregnate asbestos lining stock with asphalt solution: Loads vacuum tank with rolls of asbestos lining, using hoist. Turns valves to admit specified quantities of asphalt solution into tank. Turns steam valves to heat tanks, observes temperature control chart, and adjusts coolant valves to maintain temperature within specified limits. Removes impregnated rolls of asbestos from tank and slides them into oven, using hoist. Allows material to beat for specified time to complete impregnating process. Starts blower to dry and exhaust fumes from asbestos. May standardize width and thickness of asbestos lining [CALENDER-MACHINE OPERATOR]. May test impregnated stock to insure conformance to specifications, using brake-testing machine. May deliver samples to control laboratory. May tend mixing machine to prepare impregnating solution [MIXING-MACHINE OPERATOR (any ind.)].

Title: ASSEMBLER, PRODUCTION
Definition: Performs one or more repetitive bench or line assembly operations to mass produce products, such as automobile or tractor radiators, blower wheels, refrigerators, or gas stoves: Places parts in specified relationship to each other. Bolts, clips, screws, cements, or otherwise fastens parts together by hand, or using handtools or portable powered tools. May tend machines, such as arbor presses or riveting machine, to perform force fitting or fastening operations on assembly line. May be assigned to different work stations as production needs require. May work on line where tasks vary as different model of same article moves along line. May be specified according to part or product produced.

Title: SEWING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates sewing machine to join parts of needle-punched felt to form articles, such as automobile trunk flooring, seat facings, and floor coverings. Changes needles in machines according to specifications. May fold and sew tape to bind exposed edges of articles and be designated SEWING- M A CHINE OPERATOR, EDGING.

Title: SAMPLE WORKER
Definition: sample girt.Prepares garments or household articles, such as curtains, draperies, rugs, or towels, for use as display samples, performing any combination of the following duties: Assembles garments or articles into sets, and folds articles. Pins or glues identification tickets or labels to articles. Wraps paper bands around article, securing ends of bands with glue, or inserts articles into plastic or cellophane bags. Cuts swatches from bolts of cloth, using scissors or pinking shears, and sews swatches together or glues swatches onto cards for display with articles. Arranges articles in boxes in an attractive display and stores samples according to style, size, and color. Fills customer or sales orders, following order ticket. Records number of articles received, sample sets prepared, and samples shipped. Inventories samples in stock and requisitions replacement articles. Tends machine to print identification tickets or labels [TICKETER].

Title: BASE-DRAW OPERATOR
Definition: Tends electric furnace that anneals base sections of hardened projectile bodies to facilitate subsequent machining operations: Lifts projectile from conveyor with tongs and fits it in holder on machine table. Pushes switch, activating mechanism that elevates table and thrusts projectile base into furnace unit. Observes dial indicator and presses button to keep flow of current within prescribed limits. Removes projectile when table descends automatically. Quenches projectile base in water.

Title: BLOCK-BREAKER OPERATOR
Definition: digester operator. Feeds equipment that breaks up cakes of dehydrated nitrocotton to facilitate subsequent mixing processes in manufacture of explosives: Feeds nitrocotton cakes into mechanically driven screen that sifts material through wire mesh or feeds cakes into hopper of electrically powered cylinder fitted with spikes which break up cakes. Removes nitrocotton for further processing.

Title: SALESMAN DRIVER
Definition: commercial chauffeur; deliveryrman; delivery-track driver, light; route agent; route driver; routeman; salesman, rente.Drives truck over established route to deliver, sell, and display products or render services: Loads truck with Items, such as laundry, magazines, beer, dairy products, or bakery products. Drives truck to deliver items to customer's home or place of business. Calls on prospective customers to solicit new business. Informs regulai customers of new products or services. May writ delivery orders. May collect for deliveries. May place stock on shelves or racks. May set up sales displays and posters. May collect or pick up empty containers or rejected merchandise. May be designated according to product delivered or service rendered as BAKERY- WAGON DRIVER (bake, prod.); ICE-CREAM SALESMAN (ret. tr.); ICEMAN (ice; ret. tr.); LAUNDRY ROUTEMAN (laund.); MILKMAN (dairy prod.); SALESMAN, BEVSRAOES (whole, tr.).

Title: BLUEPRINTING-AND-PHOTOCOPY SUPERVISOR
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of BLUEPRINTING-MACHINE OPERATOR, PHOTOSTAT OPERATOR; FILE CLERK I (clerical) and other workers engaged in making and filing blueprints, vandyke and Ozalid prints, and photostats in an industrial plant or commercial photocopy laboratory: Sets up blueprint and photostat machines. Trains workers in operation of machines. Inspects finished prints for sharpness, density of line, and size. Consults with customers about work details such as sizes of prints and prices.
