Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in treating wood products with preserving and fire proofing chemicals: Analyzes production charts, manuals, customer specifications, and examines types of wood to determine treatment of wood. Orders treating sequence, type of chemicals used for treatment, temperature, and pressure in retort, and length of time wood is to remain in retort. Observes gages and progression charts to detect malfunctioning equipment, and adjusts controls to regulate temperature, pressure or level of liquid in retort to correct malfunction. Tests wood borings, using laboratory equipment, to verify specified treating solution and moisture content, retention of preservative, and depth of penetration and concentration of salt. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (and ind.).

Title: CONTROL MAN
Definition: Controls temperature, chemical composition, and level of cryolite baths in reduction pots to smelt aluminum oxide into aluminum: Breaks off sample piece of crust formed on bath surface and grinds it into powder, using roll crusher. Routes sample to laboratory for anaylsis. Dips out sample of solution and pours it into containers, using ladle. Drops chemicals into sample and notes resultant color. Adds specified amounts of chemicals and alloys to bath, according to color shade of sample to maintain solution at specified level and composition. Measures current flow and voltage between electrical connections on pots, using meters, and computes voltage drop between connections. Measures temperature of bath, heat exchangers, and heat control pipes, using pyrometer, and turns rheostat to regulate temperature. Verifies specified distance between electrodes, using measuring rod. Measures depth of bath and computes amount of aluminum available for tapping. Records tests made, amount of chemicals and alloys added to bath, and amount of aluminum tapped from pots.

Title: SILK FINISHER
Definition: Presses drycleaned and wetcleaned silk and synthetic fiber garments, using hot-head press or steamtable, puff irons, and hand iron: Operates machine presses to finish those parts that can be pressed flat and completes other parts of garments by pressing with hand iron. Finishes parts difficult to reach, such as flounces, by fitting parts over puff irons. Finishes velvet garments by steaming them on buck of hot-head press or steam- table, and brushing pile (nap) with handbrush. Finishes fancy garments, such as evening gowns and costumes, with hand iron, applying knowledge of fabrics and heats to produce high quality finishes which cannot be obtained on machine presses. Presses ties on small pressing machine or by inserting heated metal form into tie and touching up rough places with hand iron. Finishes pleated garments, determining size of pleat from evidence of old pleat or from work order (for new garments) and presses them with machine press or hand iron. In establishments where many SILK FINISHERS are employed may be designated according to specialty as FINISHER, HAND; FORM-FINISHING MACHINE OPERATOR (clean., dye, & press.; laund.); HOT-HEAD- MACHINE OPERATOR (clean., dye., & press.; laund.); PLEAT PRESSER; PUFF-IRON-OPERATOR (clean., dye., & press.; laund.); TIE PRESSER; VELVET STEAMER.

Title: SQUEEZER OPERATOR
Definition: squeezer man. Tends machine that squeezes tongue and groove boards together: Adjusts machine for length, width, and thickness of finished piece. Starts machine. Positions matched boards on feed table from which they are automatically fed into machine that squeezes them together.

Title: ENGINEER, STANDARDS AND NALYSIS
Definition: Develops and implements methods and standards for application to design and performance evaluation of rocket engines and related airframe structures: Conducts or collaborates in actual or simulated mission studies to analyze interior and exterior ballistics and evaluate capabilities of alternate propulsion systems and related structural components relative to mission objectives. Collaborates with engineering and scientific personnel and provides technical direction in analysis and translation of complex testdata into most efficient and practical propulsion systems and structural designs consistent with customer specifications.

Title: MATRIX-BATH ATTENDANT
Definition: Maintains electrolytic baths in operating condition for plating phonograph record matrices: Draws sample of solution from tanks, using pipette. Tests strength of solution, using hydrometer, and adds specified amounts of metallic salts, acid, or water to solution as needed. Examines anodes for specified size and for position in baths. Tests electrical connections by moving controls to determine whether they have been properly made.

Title: MORTGAGE CLERK
Definition: Performs any of following duties in processing real-estate loans: Types legal papers and other documents affecting title to real estate. Examines loan documents, such as deeds, assignments, and mortgages, to assure conformance to escrow instructions, policy, and legal requirements. Obtains title and hazard insurance policies and computes fees, charges and mortgage settlement figures, allocates charges, orders disbursement of funds, and records loan documents to complete real-estate loan transactions. Examines hazard insurance policies to insure adequate protection against loss on mortgaged property. Records loan data on file cards and keeps files to guard against tax deliquencies and expiration of Insurance policies. Types and mails tax and insurance premium notices to remind customers of payment due. Interviews applicants for loans to obtain Information for bank officials. May compute capital gains and keep expense and depreciation ledgers for tax purposes. May be designated according to tasks assigned as ESCROW CLERK (clerical); FORECLOSURE CLERK (clerical); HAZARD-INSURANCE CLERK (insurance); RELEASE CLERK (clerical); TAX CLERK (clerical).

Title: ARTIFICIAL-BREEDING DISTRIBUTOR
Definition: Manages distributorship concerned with collecting and packaging bull semen and inseminating cows: Hires, trains, and supervises ARTIFICIAL-BREEDING TECHNICIAN. Prepares and issues advertising, speaks at farm organization meetings, and judges cattle shows to develop contacts with potential farmer-customers and to promote artificial breeding of cattle. Trains technicians in product knowledge, artificial insemination methods, and sales techniques. Organizes and coordinates sales and service functions and publishes material to motivate technicians and inform them of current breeding developments. Keeps customers' accounts and breeding and herd records for distributorship. Collects accounts due. Orders supplies, equipment, and promotional materials for technicians. May perform breeding services.

Title: SEAT INSTALLER
Definition: Installs seats in assembly halls or rooms, such as theaters, auditoriums, and schoolrooms: Lays out and marks seating arrangement on floor, according to blueprint specifications, using chalk. Drills holes in floor and walls for bolts and screws to secure seat in position, using power drill. Secures seat to floor, wall, or other seats, using wrench and screwdriver.

Title: INSTRUMENT INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspector, instrumenta. Inspects, tests, and adjusts airplane navigational and control instruments according to specifications, using handtools and precision testing equipment: Examines pressure, vacuum, and electrical instruments, such as altimeters, airspeed indicators, oil and fuel gages, bank and turn indicators, radar beacon sets, and directional gyroscopes, for such defects, as broken dials and scratched surfaces. Connects instruments to flight simulation equipment and uses standard testing devices, such as pressure gages, signal generators, voltmeters, and ammeters, to determine that instruments meet specifications. Inspects microinch valves and dynamic balance of gyrorotors, using instruments, such as micrometers, gages, and calipers. Sets torque valves, adjusts gear trains, and calibrates instruments, using handtools. Fills in rejection tags for defective in-struments. May be designated according to type of instruments inspected as INSPECTOR, ELECTRONIC INSTRUMENTS.

Title: BANDER-AND-CELLOPHANER HELPER, MACHINE
Definition: banding-and-cellophane- wrapping-machine-operator helper. Assists BANDER- AND-CELLOPHANER, MACHINE in wrapping trademark band and cellophane wrapper around cigars. Performs other duties a? described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: CHUCKING-MACHINE SET-UP MAN
Definition: chucking -lathe wet-up man. Sets up single- or multiple-spindle chucking machines (lathes) for LATHE OPERATORS, PRODUCTION and operates machines to machine first-run work pieces [ChUCKING -MACHINE SET -UP OPERATOR].

Title: FOREIGN-SERVICE OFFICER
Definition: diplomat. Represents interests of United States and its nationals in foreign countries: Interprets American foreign policy to government and nationals of foreign countries, providing information regarding the United States which will promote international good will and understanding. Negotiates with foreign governments to protect American shipping, legal and economic interests, and welfare of resident or visiting nationals. Issues passports to American citizens and visas to foreigners wishing to visit or emigrate to this country. Makes reports to superior or Secretary of State based on observation and analysis of conditions and developments in foreign countries affecting United States, such as political activities, trade and tariff policies, major financial transactions, market conditions, trends in public opinion, and social conditions. May act as agent of U.S. Government in negotiating treaties and protocols regarding international intercourse, commercial and tariff agreements, and understandings affecting preservation of peace.

Title: SOUS CHEF
Definition: chef assistant ; chef, under; executive-chef assistant; supervising-chef assistant. Supervises and coordinates activities of COOKS and other workers engaged in preparing and cooking foodstuffs: Observes workers engaged in preparing, portioning, and garnishing foods to insure that methods of cooking and garnishing and sizes of portions are as prescribed. Gives instructions to cooking personnel in fine points of cooking. Cooks and carves meats, and prepares dishes, such as sauces, during rush periods and for banquets and other social functions. Assumes responsibility for kitchen in absence of EXECUTIVE CHEF. In establishments not employing an EXECUTIVE CHEF may be designated SUPERVISING CHEF.

Title: RULING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Sets up and operates machine to draw straight ink lines on paper sheets according to specifications: Inserts ruling pens in beam of machine, spacing them to draw lines as specified on sample sheet or work order. Sets paper guides to size of sheet. Outs and folds pads of wool flannel, soaks them in ink, and attaches them to beam over pens. Soaks pieces of wool yarn in ink and attaches them to pads and pens. Pisces stack of paper sheets on toed board of machine or installs roll of paper in machine if machine is roll-fed. Starts machine and examines lines being drawn on sheets to detect variations in line widths or color tone. Prepares ink solutions and maintains supply of ink for pens. Cleans pens and machine with solvent. May supervise workers in supplying paper stock to machine. May set up and operate one or more machines. When operating roll-fed machine, equipped with paper cutter and two sets of pens to draw horizontal and vertical lines, may be designated L-TYPE-RULING-MACHINE OPERATOR (print. & pub.).

Title: STOPBOARD ASSEMBLER
Definition: Fits and assembles wood soundboard, cast metal plate, and wood bridges to wood frame to build back panel of pianos: Operates gluing press, using jigs, to glue supporting ribs and bridges to soundboard and soundboard to frame. Tends chamfering machine that cuts notches in ribs. Varnishes soundboard and ribs. Measures and marks back panel, using ruler and calipers, to position plate that holds string and secures plate with clamps. Marks panel with punch and drills boles, using drill press. Planes bridges to specified height with hand plane, following templates. Locates and marks boles for bridge pins, using template and punch. Drills holes in bridges, using portable drill, and hammers pins into holes. Replaces metal plate and secures with bolts and screws. Verifies alinement of plate with bridges, using templates. Inserts shims or removes wood from frame to adjust level of plate to obtain required alinement. Hammers wood bushings into tuning pin holes in plate. Drills holes in bushings, using drill press, and hammers pins into bushings. May operate electronic-gluing press to perform gluing operations. May be designated according to operation performed as BRIDGE NOTCHER; PINNER; SOUND-BOARD ASSEMBLER.

Title: BENCH ASSEMBLER
Definition: subasssembler. Assembles parts to form power lawnmower components, such as reels, steering handles, and gear boxes, following specifications and using handtools and power tools: Fits parts of components together and fastens them with bolts and cotter pins, using handtools and pneumatic impact wrench. Rivets reel blades to hubs on reel shaft, using pneumatic clinching gun, and sets rivets, using rivet press [RIVETING-MACHINE OPERATOR I (any ind.)]. May be designated according to part assembled as REEL FABRICATOR.

Title: CHAIR-FORMING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machines that automatically cut wire and form chain: Loads coil of wire on turntable of machine, using hoist. Clips binder off coil, straightens and files end of wire, and threads it through machine. Starts machine that cuts and forms chain. Opens shave link and connects formed chain with chain in boxes. Lubricates machines and cleans chain. May replace defective links.

Title: AXMAN, SURVEYING
Definition: Cuts and clears brush and trees from line of survey as directed by INSTRUMENT MAN (profess. & kin.), using brush hook, knife, ax, or other cutting tools. May carry and set stakes for surveying party [STAKE MAN]. Duties of this job are frequently performed by CHAINMAN; RODMAN.

Title: COOKER, PROCESS CHEESE
Definition: cook blender. Tends vat to cook blended cheeses or cheese curd and other ingredients to make process cheese: Starts agitator and signals for cheese to be dropped into vat. Turns steam valve and observes thermometer to heat vat to specified temperature. Measures or weighs out prescribed ingredients, such as sodium citrate, di- sodium phosphate, and cream, using scale and measuring glass. Dumps ingredients into vat. Cooks mixture at sped fled temperature for specified time or observes consistency of mixture to determine when it is cooked to specifications. Pulls lever to drain cheese into hopper or bucket. May pump cheese through viscolizer to achieve finer texture. May mix unheated cheese or cheese curd and other ingredients to make cold pack cheese or creamed cheese and be designated CREAM-CHEESE MAKER.

Title: PROOFING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: proofer. Sets up and operates machine to produce proof print from etched printing rollers for verifying accuracy of etchings on rollers: Spreads length of cloth on gummed printing drum. Lifts printing roller into position on machine, using hoist, and moves lever to close machine chucks onto ends of roller. Alines pitch marker with register point on roller and turns thumbscrew to tighten marker. Loops cable from weights over hooks on doctor blade to hold blade securely against printing roller. Mixes colors to correspond with colors in design and pours color between doctor blade and roller. Releases brake on printing drum and moves lever to force drum against roller. Starts machine rotating printing roller one complete turn to print impression on cloth. Replaces roller in machine with succeeding rollers in sequence, alining rollers with fixed pitch marker to place each portion of printed design in register. Removes printed impression from drum. Cleans machine and rollers with cleaning solution and dries rollers with paper towel.

Title: MODEL MAKER, FLUORESCENT LIGHTING
Definition: Lays out and constructs experimental models of fluorescent lighting fixtures, such as those used in buildings and tunnels, following blueprints, designs, and engineering sketches: Computes dimensions and lays out outline of fixture on sheet metal, using rule, scribe, and drafting tools. Cuts and shapes metal, using hand and power brakes, shears, files, and mallets. Assembles fixture and installs electrical components and wiring, using spot-welding machine and handtools. Fastens glass or plastic lens in place with clips, bolts, or screws and (???) fluorescent tube in sockets. Connects fixture to electrical outlet and tests continuity of fixture's circuit, using circuit tester. Records dimensions, (???) angles, hole locations, and other specifications for use in production of fixture. May inspect installed fixtures and make minor repairs.

Title: ELECTROFORMER
Definition: Sprays or smears electrically conductive solution onto nan- conductive objects, such as baby shoes or plastic molds, or dips objects in solution to prepare them for electroplating. May electroplate objects [PLATER].

Title: CONTRACT CLERK SUPERVISOR
Definition: service representative supervisor. Supervises and coordinates activities of CONTRACT CLERKS (light, heat, & power; tel. & tel.) engaged in handling service orders and complaints of telephone customers: Listens in on service calls [SERVICE OBSERVER]. Recommends corrective services to adjust customer complaints. Spot checks accounting ledger and order postings for accuracy. Answers questions about service. Compiles work volume statistics for accounting purposes. Performs other duties as described under SUPERVISOR (clerical).

Title: PRIMER-WATERPROOFING-MACHINE ADJUSTER
Definition: lacquer-press adjuster. Sets up dial-feed machine to daub and spray lacquer to base and mouth of cartridge cases to form waterproof seal around primer and bullet: Alines and adjusts feeding, lacquering, blotting, and ejecting mechanisms, and installs reels of blotting-paper tape, using handtools. Thins lacquer with acetate to desired consistency and pours it into machine reservoirs. Measures drain time of sample mixture to verify conformance to specified viscosity, using electric timer. Drains and flushes reservoirs and feed tubes to prevent clogging, using thinner.

Title: BLEACHER HELPER
Definition: bleach- house helper; bleach-house worker. Assists BLEACHER in mixing bleaching chemicals, removing bleached garments from machine, and by performing other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: SAMPLER
Definition: laboratory sample man ample boy. Draws samples of petroleum products from various parts of refinery for laboratory analysis, using sample container: Samples contents of tank cars, processing units, stills, and pipelines by lowering sample bottle or metal container into contents at various depths, or by opening bleeder valves to release flow of products into containers. Collects samples taken by other workers. Pours samples from containers into sample bottles and ties Identification tags to bottles or marks identifying Information on them. Delivers sample to laboratory for analysis. May transmit messages between laboratory and processing units. May collect samples of other materials for laboratory analysis. May drive truck or jitney to gather samples.

Title: BUFFER
Definition: polisher; tripoler. Polishes parts of assembled smoking pipes: Secures buffing wheel on machine arbor, using wrench. Dips part into polishing compound or applies compound with fingers. Starts machine and guides part against rotating wheel, varying pressure to impart luster and seal pores of briar. May be designated according to part of pipe polished as BITTRIPOLER; or according to compound used as LACQUER POLISHER; SHELLAC-POLISH MAN.

Title: ATTENDANT, PHYSICAL THERAPY
Definition: physical-therapy aid. Prepares patients for treatment by PHYSICAL THERAPIST: Assists patients in dressing, undressing, and moving about. Sets up and assembles such equipment as hydrotherapy tanks and vibrators. Places patients in position for treatment. Times length of treatment. Changes linen on beds and treatment tables, and cleans work area. May assist in fitting patients with corsets, braces, and hand splints.

Title: HONEYCOMB-BLANKET MAKER
Definition: metal-honeycomb processor; honeycomb-paper fabricator. Fabricates honeycomb-core blankets from fiber glass, paper, or aluminum foil, used to insulate and strengthen aircraft wing, tail, and fuselage sections: Tends machines that automatically crimp, glue, and cut paper, foil, and fiber glass sheets to form honeycomb. Builds up honeycomb core sections in sequence to form blanket of specified thickness. Dips blankets formed from paper in chemical solution, and dries them in oven to increase strength of paper. Cuts and trims blanket to shape of part to be reinforced, using power shear, hand knife, router equipped with milling head, or handsaw. Bonds metal or fiber glass skin to shaped blanket, using adhesive and press, or vacuum pressure and oven heat. May be designated according to operation performed as ADHESIVE-SPREADER OPERATOR; BLANKET-MACHINE OPERATOR: CORE-SAW OPERATOR: CORRUGATING-MACHINE OPERATOR; PANEL-LAY-UP MAN; PRESS OPERATOR.

Title: FORMS ANALYST
Definition: forms coordinator. Approves designs of printed forms and controls their use: Reviews requests to determine justifications for new or revised forms. Recommends format and content of forms to reduce duplication, inventories, and clerical preparation time, and to insure inclusion of specified Information. Prepares and issues written instructions for use of forms in accordance with company procedures. Examines content and format of vendors' proofs for adherence to purchase specifications for printing and binding. Corrects and approves proofs. Maintains distribution list and records of forms. May compare cost statements and calculate savings resulting from development of new or revised forms. May design new forms.

Title: MANAGER, FARM
Definition: farm overseer; manager, agricultural; superintendent, farm. Manages farm on behalf of employer, applying knowledge of management and farming techniques: Confers with landowner to plan sequence of farming activities, according to size of farm, labor supply, machinery and equipment available, and operating costs. Orders supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, and farming equipment needed to carry out fanning plan. Plans and directs crop rotation to insure maximum production from soil according to soil analysis and past crops grown. Directs activities of FARM HANDS engaged in laying out, planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops, and in maintaining machinery. Informs landowner of progress and condition of crops and estimated yield. Records operating expenses, such as labor costs, materials used, machinery repairs, and equipment purchased to determine profits and initiate future fanning activities. May work on commission basis.

Title: COMPOSITION-WEATHERBOARD APPLIER
Definition: composition-aiding man. Applies composition weatherboard to exterior of buildings: Cuts, fits, and nails sections of composition weatherboard to building. Trims sections around windows, doors, and other apertures with molding. Fastens reinforced copper corners to building.

Title: OFFICE-MACHINE-SERVICEMAN FOREMAN
Definition: office-equipment-repair-shop foreman; service-shop foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in serving, repairing, and rebuilding office machines, such as calculating, tabulating, bookkeeping, duplicating machines, and typewriters, in customer's establishment and in repair shop. May review reports on unserviceable machines and examine them to determine repairs required and to estimate cost of repair. May compute cost of repaired items. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN. When supervising workers in repair shop, may be designated OFFICE-MACHINE-REPAIR-SHOP FOREMAN.

Title: ROLL BUILDER
Definition: Assembles roughing stands used on rolling mills, following rolling orders, using handtools: Signals ELECTRIC-BRIDGE-OR- GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to position specified rolls in stands. Insets rolls in housing, installs roll bearings, and bolts rolls in place, using handtools. Installs specified guides on stands, using handtools. Grinds guides, using portable grinder, to insure smooth passage of steel through mill. Disassembles roll stands removed from line and examines parts to determine need for replacement. Sorts and stores rolling equipment. Records size, quantity, and condition of rolls.

Title: STOCK SUPPLIER, TYPE SOLDERERS
Definition: type supplier. Selects and supplies sets of type-bar-and-segment assemblies, matrix plates, trays of typewriter type, keyboard diagrams, and space gages to TYPE-SOLDERING-MACHINE OPERATORS. Selects bar-and-segment assemblies, racks of type, space gages, and keyboard diagrams according to proccss order. Examines components to verify that they match as a set with process order. Observes work stations and supplies sets to operators. Poets items issued to workers on production records and keeps files of diagrams and orders.

Title: SAWMILL WORKER
Definition: Performs any combination of following duties in preparing logs for cutting into lumber and storing cut lumber in sawmill: Unloads logs from trucks or cars. Rolls logs onto sawmill deck [DECKMAN). Examines logs for defects, such as imbedded pieces of iron or stone, decayed wood and splits, and marks them for removal by other workers. Rolls logs from deck onto log carriage (LOG TURNER]. Rides log carriage of head saw and adjusts position of logs on carriage to cut planks of required thickness (BLOCK SETTER]. Sorts and guides planks emerging from saw onto roller tables or conveyors for trimming edges. Straightens lumber on moving conveyors [LUMBER STRAIGHTER] . Operates sawing machine to straigh ten edges of rough lumber [EDGER MAN I]. May operate and maintain donkey engines. May sharpen and adjust teeth of woodworking saws [SAW FILER (any ind.)]. May tend fires in donkey engine.

Title: FOREMAN, PAPER MACHINE
Definition: paper-machine foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in operating paper-making machines to make cardboard, paper, and pulp sheets from pulp stock, and to wind and cut paper sheets: Directs workers in installing wet and dry felts and wire mesh belts in machine, and in threading paper through feed, press, drier, and calendar rolls. Observes consistency of pulp and reads laboratory reports of moisture, caliber, and oil tests to verify conformation of product to quality control specifications. Supervises workers in requisitioning, repairing, and maintaining wire mesh belts, wet and dry felts, and machine accessories and parts. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to machines operated by workers supervised as FOURDRINIER-PAPER-MACHINE FOREMAN; or according to product as SUPERINTENDENT, BOARD MILL.

Title: ASSEMBLER, TOY VOICES
Definition: Performs any combination of following tasks to assemble voice mechanisms in toys: Positions metal sleeves on turntable holders, and inserts voice mechanisms in sleeves while depressing pedal to turn table and position sleeves. Places wooden plugs in holders of second turntable and Inserts preassembled voice mechanism in plugs. Moves parts from one turntable to another, and finally positions parts under automatic tool that secures mechanism in plugs and ejects assembled unit into container.

Title: COMPOUNDER FINISHER
Definition: tempering man. Tends mixing machine to finish mixing of matchhead compound to produce mixture of specified viscosity: Lifts kettles of compounds from cart onto mixer with hoist. Starts mixer and pours dye solution into compound. Sets thermostat or opens valve to admit steam into jacket around kettle to heat compound if specified and verifies temperature with thermometer. Fills graduated dipper with compound and times flow of compound from dipper with stopwatch to test vis- costly. Adds specified ingredient according to test results until viscosity is correct.

Title: COMPRESSOR
Definition: Sets up and operates machine to compress granulated ingredients into medicinal tablets of specified site and shape: Installs dies in machine and adjusts spring tension and ram pressure of air- or hydraulic powered press according to specifications, using hand- tools. Scoops or dumps ingredients into hopper and starts machine. Examines, feels, and crumbles product to detect imperfections, such as surface chips and pits, soft centers, and excessive brittleness. Measures, weighs, and tests samples, using micrometer, scale, hardness tester, or routes product to laboratory for analysis. Readjusts machine pressure and tension to correct product flaws to insure conformity with size and weight specifications. Removes and cleans dies and compression chambers.

Title: FOREMAN, PIGMENT MAKING
Definition: supervisor, color making. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in grinding, dispersing, filtering, drying, and mixing chemicals to produce color pigments: Inspects mechanical equipment and pipelines for defects. Adjusts meters, gages, and automatic controls, and repairs equipment, using hand tools. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to function as COLOR- CONTROL FOREMAN; COLOR-MARINO FOREMAN; DRYING-ROOM FOREMAN; FILTER-PRESS FOREMAN; GRINDING-ROOM FOREMAN.

Title: GAGE CONTROLLER
Definition: gage in- specter. Tests gages used in manufacture and assembly of watches: Inspects and tests gages for accuracy, using master gages and micrometers, microscopes, projection machines, and other precision instruments. Verifies coordinates of transfer plates with microscope, and alines needle gages with standard-hole-size jewels. Issues gages to using departments and maintains perpetual inventory of gages. Sets up and maintains precision instruments used in testing gages. May test dimensions and hardness of metal sheets, rods, and blanks, for adherence to specifications.

Title: CALENDERING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: calenderer; finisher; folding-machine operator; mangle tender, doth; rolling-up-machine operator. Tends machine that stretches and sets circular knitted cloth (knit tubing) to uniform width: Turns screws to adjust width of spreader according to specifications. Turns valves to admit steam into steam box that sets stretched cloth. Threads cloth over feed and guide rollers, around spreader, through steam box, and between pressure rolls, and wraps end of cloth around takeup roll or guides end through swing-folding attachment. Starts machine and observes flow of cloth to detect cloth defects, such as dirt, dye streaks, and holes. Cuts defects from cloth, using shears. Measures width of calendered cloth with hand rule. Cuts calendered cloth with shears or automatic cutter attached to machine and dolls rolls of cloth from machine. May lower top pressure roller to press cloth. May attach identification tag to end of cloth bolt. May operate calender fed from rolls, handtruck, or another machine.

Title: CLERK AND DISPATCHER, PILOT STATION
Definition: Dispatches PILOT, SHIP to ships entering or leaving port: Writes up order showing name of ship, berth, tugboat company, and time of arrival or departure, and notifies PILOT, SHIP and pilot boat operator of assignment. Obtains receipt of pilotage from pilot upon return from ship. Records charges on receipt, using tariff book as guide. Compiles reports of activities, such as number of ships piloted and charges made. Keeps records of ships entering port, showing owner, name of ship, displacement tonnage, agent, and country of registration. May be required to possess Radio- Telephone Operator's license and operate radar to fix position and speed of ships entering and leaving port.

Title: ELECTRIC-DISTRIBUTION CHECKER
Definition: distribution checker. Inspects and tests electric distribution equipment and wiring outside and within buildings to verify conformance of installation with construction and building code specifications or to determine feasibility of increasing electrical load: Examines wires and auxiliary equipment, such as fuses, insulators, and switches, and compares them to work orders, utilizing a thorough knowledge of types, sizes, and styles to determine if equipment follows specifications. Compares layout and methods of installation to blueprints and sketches and marks differentiations on drawings. Climbs poles to compare printed data on transformers with work orders and to examine wires and auxiliary equipment on poles. Approves installations or records inaccuracies on work orders. Tests lines, transformers, and other distribution equipment, using such devices as ohm meters, voltmeters, and thermocouple indicators, to measure voltage drop between points in circuitry, locate cause of electrical disturbances, and determine actual electrical load on system. Tests for temperature and presence of explosive gases in vicinity of electrified equipment.

Title: SPRINGER
Definition: hand tier; springer-op; spring man; spring setter; spring locker; spring tier; spring upholsterer; spring-up man. Installs webbing and springs in furniture frames preparatory to upholstering: Tacks or staples ends of webbing strips to side of frame, using tack hammer or staple gun. Stretches webbing across frame with webbing stretcher and tacks ends to opposite side of frame. Tacks strips to back of frame and weaves them through crosspieces to cover opening. Cuts webbing overlap with hand shears. Positions coil springs on webbing and fastens spring to webbing with needle and twine or with metal clips, using clinching tool. Tacks twine to edges of frame opening and laces and ties twine to springs to stabilize and secure them in place. Cuts burlap or canvas to cover springs, places cover on springs, and tacks to edges of frame. May fasten border wire to springs, using metal clips or by twisting crimp wire around border wire and top of spring. May cover frame opening by attaching web- fabric panels to frame withsmall springs. May sew heavy paper over border wire, using needle and stitching twine to soften edge.

Title: FINISH OPENER, JEWEL HOLE
Definition: jewel-hole finish opener. Operates Jewel- opening machine to smooth and polish jewel holes to size: Mounts wire, on which Jewels are strung, in ma chine, pulls wire taut, and forces sleeve like devices against each end of jewel row to force jewels tightly together. Brushes shellac over jewels and allows them to harden. Starts belt which causes row of jewels to rotate around wire. Pulls diamond-dusted tapered wire back and forth through rotating jewels to enlarge and polish holes. Pulls thicker portion of wire into working position until hole reaches specified diameter. Verifies size of hole on graduated tapered needle. Works to tolerances of 0.0001 inch.

Title: CORRESPONDENCE-REVIEW CLERK
Definition: Reads incoming correspondence and routes to individual or department concerned. Requisitions records needed to process correspondence. Types acknowledgement letter to person sending correspondence.

Title: LAY-OFF MAN
Definition: stamper. Tends machine that stencils design onto cloth as outline for tufting: Staples stencil (raised pattern) around stencil cylinder. Lays marking bar (colored paraffin) in holder. Mounts roll of cloth on machine brackets, threads cloth between stencil and marking bar, and laps cloth around takeup roller. Places weights on marking bar to hold bar against cloth. Starts machine that draws cloth between stencil and marking bar, transferring design in paraffin to cloth. Doffs rolls of stenciled cloth from delivery end of machine.

Title: TUBE CLEANER
Definition: Cleans scale from inside of tubes that are used in boilers, kilns, and stills to circulate hot air or water: Removes plugs or assemblies from tube ends, using hand tools. Pushes compressed- air rotary scraper or wire brush through tubes to scraps- scales from interior surfaces. Flushes or blows our loosened deposits, using water or air hose. May inspect tubes by drawing electric light through them. May be designated according to type of tube cleaned as BOILER- TUBE REAMER; EVAPORATOR REPAIRMAN (chem); FLUE CLEANER; STILL CLEANER, TUBE (petrol, refin.;; TAR HEAT-EXCHANGER CLEANER (petrol, refin.). May steam clean outside of boiler tubes and be designated BOILER-TUBE BLOWER.

Title: BOTTLE GAGER
Definition: gager. Measures quantity and temperature of whisky in bottles as they are filled by bottle-filling machine: Removes, at random, filled bottle of whisky from conveyor, empties contents into graduated cylinder, and records scale reading indicating fluid ounces. Inserts thermometer in cylinder to measure temperature of whisky and records temperature. Compares readings with charts indicating desired company standards to insure that high quality of product is maintained during bottling process. Pours contents of cylinder back into bottle and places bottle on conveyor for labeling. Records size of bottle being filled, serial numbers, and brand of whisky.

Title: KITCHEN HELPER
Definition: cookee; cook helper; kitchen hand; kitchen man; kitchen porter; kitchen runner. Performs any combination of the following duties to maintain kitchen work areas and restaurant equipment and utensils in clean and orderly condition: Sweeps and mops floors. Washes work tables, walls, refrigerators, and meat blocks. Segregates and removes trash and garbage and places it in designated containers. Steam-cleans or hoses-out garbage cans. Sorts bottles and breaks disposable ones in bottle-crushing machine. Washes pots, pans, and trays by hand. Scrapes food from dirty dishes and washes them by hand or places them in racks or on conveyor to dishwashing machine. Places silver in revolving burnishing- machine tumbler, dips it in chemical solutions, holds it against buffing wheel, and rubs it with cloth to remove tarnish and restore luster. Holds inverted glasses over revolving brushes to clean inside surfaces. Transfers supplies and equipment between storage and work areas by hand or by use of hand truck. Sets up banquet tables. Washes and peels vegetables, using knife or peeling machine. May be known according to task performed as DISHWASHER, HAND; DISHWASHER, MACHINE; GARBAGE- MAN; POTWASHER; SILVERMAN.

Title: MIME
Definition: pantomimiest. Presents serious, humorous, or burlesqued interpretations of emotions, dramatic actions, and various situations through body movements, facial expressions, and gestures.

Title: SALESMAN, SHOE LEATHER AND FINDINGS
Definition: Sells shoe leather and shoe repairing supplies, such as eyelets, welts, polish, and handtools, performing duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.).

Title: DEBRANDER
Definition: brander. Melts brand name from articles of plastic footwear, such as rubbers or overshoes, for sale under another vendor's name, using electrically heated tool resembling soldering iron. Cleans adhering plastic from tool tip by rubbing on wire brush.

Title: SHEAR-GRINDER-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: Assists SHEAR-GRINDER OPERATOR in sharpening cloth-shearing machine blades: Removes blades from shearing machines and trucks blades to and from grinding area. Positions blades in jig or chuck of grinding machines. Hands SHEAR-GRINDER OPERATOR tools or supplies as directed. Spreads oil and emery powder on blades as blades are being lapped together. Bolls sharpened blades in vats to remove oil and abrasive dust. Applies oil preservative to blades. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: LEATHER STAMPER
Definition: decorator; leather tooler; tooler. Cuts and stamps lettering and decorative designs on leather saddles, purses, belts, and novelties: Draws design and lettering on wet leather with stylus or transfers design by placing pattern on leather and pounding with mallet. Cuts outline of design and lettering with knife. Bevels and flares edges of cuts and fills in design and background, using various stamping tools and mallet. May trim and punch leather pieces and sew them together by hand or machine. May apply various colors and shades of stain to design and background and be designated SPANISHER.

Title: SANDER, PORTABLE MACHINE
Definition: cleaner; clean-up man; hand sander. Smooths wood surfaces to facilitate finishing, using portable belt, disk, orbital or vibrator sanding machine: Attaches sheet, disk, or belt of abrasive material to machine rollers or platen, and secures it with thumbscrews or clamps. Starts machine and guides it over surfaces by hand. Inspects and feels stock for smoothness. May remove excess glue from joints, using knife, scraper, or wood chisel. May fill cracks, splits, and knotholes with wood putty or plastic wood and be known as PUTTTMAN (fum.). May sand wood surface by hand, using sandpaper.

Title: BELLOWS CHARGER
Definition: Fills capillary tubes of thermostat bellows with liquid, using vacuum pump: Turns valve and observes gage to fill holding tank with liquid. Ties bellows in bundles and stands them in dry pot connected to holding tank. Bolts lid of pot and starts vacuum pump to exhaust moisture from bellows. Turns valve to drain liquid from holding tank into capillary tubes. Pumps excess liquid back to holding tank. Lays bellows in box for removal to next process station.

Title: EDITOR, MANAGING, NEWSPAPER
Definition: managing editor. Negotiates with newspaper owner's representative to establish publication policies, and directs editorial activities of newspaper departments accordingly: Confers with owner's representatives to discuss editorial policy, make-up plans, changes in staff organization, news coverage of special events, and similar decisions. Relays information to department heads. Coordinates work of editorial departments in accordance with newspaper policy. Directs page makeup of publication as a whole, paying particular attention to front page. Inspects final makeup of editions and rearranges makeup to meet emergency news situations. Originates plans for special features or projects and assigns department heads to implement them. May write leading or policy editorials. In smaller establishments may perform duties of EDITOR, NEWS and EDITOR, CITY.

Title: LENS POLISHER
Definition: lens polisher. Polishes plastic contact lenses to prescription specifications, using lens polishing machine: Adjusts rotation arm on cam to give maximum rotation of lap on lens. Places lens in machine holding fixture, and applies liquid abrasive to lap. Positions lap on lens, places rotation arm guide in a slot of lap and starts machine. Stops machine periodically to inspect lens for correctness of curves as measured by power determining and optical centering instruments, and for scratches, using loupe. Tapes finished lenses to job order sheet and places in routing box.

Title: CABLE-SPLICER HELPER
Definition: Assists CABLE SPLICER to join ends of multiple-conductor cables used in telephone and telegraph communication systems and electric- power transmitting equipment by performing routine duties: Positions splicer's cart, opens manholes, hangs splicer's platform In position, and supplies splicer with tools and equipment. Tends small gasoline engine to pump water from underground conduit tunnels or to supply fresh air to worker in tunnel. Cuts lead tubing with hacksaw to form covering over spliced cables. Tends gasoline heater to melt lead and paraffin. Assists CABLE SPLICER in boiling out wet cables and affixing cables in tunnel racks or to poles. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: HAMMER-MILL OPERATOR
Definition: Tends hammer mill that breaks slags, slate, and similar materials into fine pieces: Starts machine and watches rate of feeding into hopper from conveyor or moves gate lever to allow materials to drop into hopper from chute. Oils and cleans machine.

Title: DRYING-UNIT-FELTING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: continuous -drier operator; drier. Tends drying chamber that removes moisture from felt strips: Opens steam valves to beat chamber to specified temperature, and opens and closes vents in chamber to control ventilation. Attaches leading edge of felt strip to books of conveyor, and starts machine to draw strip through drying chamber. Clamps leading edge of strip to winding drum as strip emerges from chamber. Cuts strip with knife when specified amount of felt is wound on drum.

Title: TIE BINDER
Definition: bander; handler. Binds neckties together prior to packing: Places cardboard forms beneath and on top of stack of folded neckties. Binds stack with rubber bands, paper strips, or tape. May stamp information, such as number of ties and tie style on cardboard forms. May slide paper or plastic identification bands onto ties or insert labels into pretied knot.

Title: HEAT CURER
Definition: Loads and unloads oven that cures color in screen-printed textiles: Hangs articles on rack and pushes rack into preheated oven. Removes articles from oven after specified time. Counts and records number of articles cured and packs them into boxes.

Title: SETTER HELPER
Definition: kiln-setter helper. Loads and moves clay products on kilncars into kilns for burning: Places setting rings on floor of kilncars or periodic kiln according to setting pattern. Moves setting table in kiln and pushes loaded trailer into kiln. Carries defective or rejected pipe from kiln. Clips pipe on kilncars to secure load. Stacks empty boards and pallets.

Title: SALESMAN, AIRCRAFT EQUIPMENT AND PARTS
Definition: salesman, acronautical and aircraft equipment. Sells aircraft equipment and parts, such as bolts, fittings, tires, and motors, performing duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.). May specialize in selling surplus stock and be designated as SALES AGENT, SURPLUS STOCK.

Title: DOWELING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: doweler; dowel-setting-machine operator. Tends machine to glue and drive dowel pins into holes in parts of wooden articles preparatory to assembly: Slides stops on machine to aline grooves, through which dowels are fed, with holes in wooden part. Dumps dowel pins into hopper and pours glue into glue reservoir. Positions part against stop and depresses pedal to apply glue and drive dowels into holes. Releases pedal and removes wooden part from machine. May mix glue.

Title: BUCKRAM SEWER
Definition: Operates sewing machine to sew buckram (stiffening material) to tops of drapery panels: Places roll of buckram on holder and draws end through guide. Positions panel under buckram and guides material under machine needle. Cuts buckram between panels, using hand shears, or presses knee lever to activate cutting blade attached to machine.

Title: TANK-FARM ATTENDANT
Definition: transfer- and -pumphouse operator. Tends series of spheres or tanks to store and distribute liquid chemicals for use in production of Industrial or consumer products, such as synthetic rubber, resins, and solvents: Observes flowmeters and pressure gages, turns valves, and starts pumps to transfer fluid chemicals to or from specified tanks and to processing areas. Maintains records of materials received and distributed, gage readings, pumping time, and storage dates. Patrols tank farm area to inspect pumps, motors, valves, piping, and electrical ground-wire connections. Reports leaks, temperature and pressure abnormalities, and other potential hazards. May regulate admission of products through preliminary processing units, such as water-treating and refrigerating units, heat exchangers, and purification and filtration equipment. May draw samples of chemicals for laboratory analysis or perform concentration, acidity, or composition tests, using standard test procedure and equipment. May circulate fluids through weigh tanks to facilitate inventory control or supply processing areas with preweighed ingredients.

Title: BOX CUTTER
Definition: 442.87.Cuts deep holes (boxes) in bases of trees with ax to form receptacles for exuded crude turpentine (oleoresin).

Title: PRODUCTION CLERK
Definition: Individual-production clerk; material-order clerk; process accounting clerk; production checker; production controller; schedule derk; scheduling supervisor; shop checker. Compiles data from customer orders, production estimates, and perpetual' inventory to prepare production schedules: Compiles production records from work tickets. Computes total number of units shipped to customers or other departments from work tickets to keep perpetual inventory. Estimates production rate of department, using production records of workers and machines. Integrates specifications of customer orders with production estimates and inventory to determine production schedule, indicating such factors as style, size, quantity, end priority. Informs customer and department supervisors of proposed shipping or transfer date. May record amount of material used [MATERIAL CLERK]. May prepare reports of production. May keep records of specific items produced and be designated accordingly as GREY-STOCK RECORDER (hosiery); HOSE COLLECTOR (hosiery); SARDINE CHECKER (can. & preserv.); SMOKE- MEAT PROCESSING CLERK (slaught. & meat pack.); STOCKING COUNTER (hosiery).

Title: ASPHALT-MIXER MAN
Definition: asphalt, plant box man; asphalt-plant weigher; oil-mix-plant weigher. Tends machine that weighs out ingredients for and mixes asphalt: Pushes levers to start mechanisms that automatically weigh sand, stone, and asphalt, and dumps them into mixing drum or box. Pushes lever to discharge contents of drum or box into truck.

Title: RADIO-DESIGN ENGINEER
Definition: Designs and coordinates construction and installation of radio, television, and allied equipment, such as radar and frequency-modulation transmitters and receivers, facsimile equipment, ships receivers, and radiosonde apparatus, performing duties as described under DESIGN ENGINEER. May be designated according to speciality as ANTENNA ENGINEER; RADAR ENGINEER; TELEVISION ENGINEER.

Title: DECATING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: doth finisher; decatirer tender; dry- decator operator; open-blower operator; seml-decator; semi-derator operator; steam finisher; steam-shrinking -machine operator; steam sponger. Tends machine that circulates steam through cloth wound on perforated cylinder to develop luster, improve hand, remove wrinkles, and shrink cloth: Turns hand wheels to set guides according to width of cloth, and pressure roll of winding unit according to tension specified. Laps end of cloth and wrapper (protective covering which removes wrinkles and holds cloth under tension) around cylinder or pins cloth to lead cloth. Starts machine to wind cloth and wrapper into single roll. Sets controls to admit steam into rotating cylinder and force steam through cloth roll, and to draw air back through cloth to cool and dry it, following instructions for style of cloth. Winds cloth and wrapper onto separate rolls, and doffs rolls of cloth, using hoist, or unwinds cloth through swing folding attachment. May tend machine that automatically steams, removes moisture, unwinds, and folds cloth. May press cloth in electric pressing machine. May tend machine that initially draws cloth over steam trough for priming.

Title: CYLINDER MAN
Definition: Tends steam-pressure cylinders that bake lime bricks and cinder blocks: Shuts and bolts doors of loaded cylinders. Turns valve to admit steam into cylinders. Observes steam-pressure gage and turns valve to adjust pressure. Opens cylinder doors to expose baked brick and cinder block. Changes chart in pressure gage and stylus after baking process.

Title: ELECTRICIAN, OFFICE
Definition: electrician, station, assistant. Makes operating adjustments in submarine cable repeater and terminal circuits and apparatus, and rearranges connections in cables to maintain continuity of service. Communicates with other cable stations by manual telegraph [MORSE OPERATOR].

Title: DEPOSITING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: first helper; starch crab. OPERATES MACHINE THAT DEPOSITS METERED AMOUNT OF FLUID CANDY IN MOLDS, ON TRAYS OR MATS, OR DIRECTLY ON CONVEYOR: OPENS VALVE OR STARTS PUMP TO FILL HOPPER OF MACHINE. OBSERVES THERMOMETER AND ADJUSTS STEAM SUPPLY TO MAINTAIN SPECIFIED TEMPERATURE IN STEAM- JACKETED MACHINE HOPPER. TURNS HAND WHEEL TO REGULATE FLOW OF CANDY FROM DEPOSITING SPOUT. POSITION TRAYS, MOLDS, OR MATS ON CONVEYOR LEADING TO MACHINE. TURNS HAND WHEEL TO SYNCHRONIZE PISTON STROKE OF DEPOSITOR WITH SPEED OF CONVEYOR BELT. WEIGHS FORMED CANDY AND ADJUSTS POURING SPOUTS TO REGULATE SPECIFIED AMOUNT OF CANDY DEPOSITED. MAY FEED TRAYS, MOLDS OR MATS INTO MACHINE BY HAND. MAY PREPARE STARCH MOLDS [Starch- maker]. MAY BE DESIGNATED ACCORDING TO CANDY FORMED AS Mint-Wafer Depositor.

Title: BOTTOMER
Definition: cageman; lander; skip tender. Pushes mine cars onto and off mine shaft cage and gives directions to workers when cage is used to carry mine personnel: Pushes or pulls loaded cars off cage at surface and replaces them with cars that are empty or loaded with supplies. Pulls empty cars from cage at bottom or intermediate levels of mine and moves them onto sidings for distribution and loading. Gives directions to workers in loading of cage to insure conformance to safety regulations. Signals HOISTMAN (any ind.) with bell or buzzer when cage is to be moved. May load cage with materials and equipment to be lowered into mine. May record number of containers and estimate production weights. May be designated according to level In mine shaft at which work is performed, such as BOTTOMER II; FOOTMAN; HEADMAN I; TOP CAGER. May tend automatic elevator.

Title: DRUM ATTENDANT
Definition: Breaker- wheel operator; drum man; mill attendant; mordant- wheel man; softener; staffer, machine; temperar; wet- milling-wheel operator. Tends machine equipped with revolving drum containing solutions that clean, dye, tan, or oil hides: Places hides in drum and locks drum door. Turns valves to fill drum with specified solution and water or steam. Moves controls to rotate dram for specified period. Stops dram, unlocks door, removes hides, and stacks them on cart or rack. May be designated according to process as BLACKING WHEELMAN; DE- GREASING-WHEEL OPERATOR; OILING-MACHINE OPERATOR; TANNING-WHEEL FILLER; WASHING-MACHINE OPERATOR. May tend machine without adding solutions to soften hides by tumbling, and be designated DRY-MILL WORKER.

Title: OVEN-EQUIPMENT REPAIRMAN
Definition: Maintains coke oven machinery and auxiliary equipment in working condition: Examines or listens to equipment, such as pushers, charging larrys, door removers, coke guides, and mud-handling equipment, to detect faulty operation or worn or damaged parts. Dismantles units and adjusts or replaces defective parts, using bars, air hammers, sledges, chisels, and wrenches. Notifies MASTER MECHANIC, MAINTENANCE (any lnd.) of major repairs required, such as replacement of defective bearings or gears and shafts.

Title: KILNMAN
Definition: Operates rotary kiln in which cinnabar (mercuric sulfide ore) is volatilized to obtained free mercury: Ignites oil burner and turns fuel and air pressure valves to heat kiln to specified temperature. Sets controls to regulate conveyor speed and rotation of kiln. Observes .gages and flow of ore into kiln and turns controls to maintain temperature and amount of ore in kiln. Lubricates and repairs kiln and equipment.

Title: ACOOUNTANT, BUDGET
Definition: Estimates expenditures expected and submits to management. Analyses records of present and past operations, trends and animated realizedrevenues, administrative commitments, and obligations, incurred. Develops, installs, and maintain! budgeting systems which provide control of expend I tone made to carry out activities, such as advertsing and marketing, production, and labor, maintenance, or project activities, such as construction of: buildings. Advises management regarding matters, such as effective use of resources and methods foi preventing capital being froten. Interprets accounts and records to management. May supervise personnel performing routine phases of accounting operations.

Title: ROLL-TENDER HELPER
Definition: Tends mixing machine and conveyors to prepare milk (slurry of flour and water) for use in making dry wallpaper adhesives: Transfers containers of flour to hopper of mixing machine, using handtruck, dumps flour into hopper, and starts machine. Turns valves to control flow of flour and water into mixing machine. Starts pumps, upon signal from ROLL TENDER, to transfer paste of flour and water through discharge line to rollers. Records data from scales and counters, and clears clogged lines.

Title: COUPON-REDEMPTION CLERK
Definition: Redeems books of trading stamps or coupons in exchange for merchandise and vacation trips: Shows customer selection of merchandise in display catalog and aids customer to make selection of merchandise. Counts books and verifies number of coupons required for requested articles. Collects taxes on merchandise. Orders or obtains merchandise from stockroom. May exchange books for cash. May keep record of books redeemed, taxes collected, and merchandise distributed. May take inventory of stock. May arrange merchandise for display on counters, racks, shelves, or stands. May wrap items.

Title: EDGER
Definition: Operates sewing machine equipped with rotary cutter to trim raw edges from articles, such as coin purses, dishcloths, glove and mitten parts, pillowcases, and washcloths, and sew edges with overedge stitch to decorate and reinforce them and prevent raveling. Guides edges under needle and through trimming attachment.

Title: SENSITIZER-AND-PRINTER
Definition: Operates equipment to coat metal sheets with photo sensitive compound and to imprint patterns of parts, such as fire-control and guidance-system reticles, on sheets, according to blueprints: Cleans metal sheets, such as copper, nickel, or stainless steel, with solvents and pumice. Mounts sheets on rotary fixture, starts mechanism, and pours solution on rotating sheet to coat it by centrifugal motion, or brushes solution on hanging sheet, or dips sheet in tank of solution. Places sensitized sheet in heating cabinet to dry. Positions and clamps pattern over sensitized sheet in vacuum printing frame. Turns on arc light to print pattern on sheet. Develops pattern by immersing exposed sheet in water which removes non- exposed portion of coating. Places developed sheet in oven to bake for specified time.

Title: HAT-BLOCKING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: hat blocker. Tends double-unit hat-blocking machine to shape white twill Navy hats: Places hat on bottom part of block (mold), pushes block forward, and pulls lever to lower upper part of block over lower section. Opens air valve that inflates rubber lining and presses crown outward against sides of block to shape (block) hat. Moves lever to raise upper section of block, releases air pressure, pulls lower section to starting position, and removes shaped hat. Stacks hats on table.

Title: PHARMACEUTICAL OPERATOR, SENIOR
Definition: laboratory technician. Controls equipment and tends machines to produce variety of pharmaceutical and toilet products or ingredients, performing any combination of the following duties: Weighs and measures out coating ingredients and coats medicinal tablets [COATER]. Tends mixing machine and heated kettles to prepare specified ingredients for ointments, creams, liquid medications, powders, gums, and similar drug products, adding ingredients according to formulas [COMPOUNDER (drug. prep. & rel. prod.; soap)]. Tends milling and grinding machines that reduce mixtures to designated sized particles or grinds materials with mortar and pestle. Prepares granulated products [GRANULATOR-MACHINE OPERATOR]. Tends filter presses, sifting machines, autoclaves, water stills, and related equipment to prepare ingredients for further processing. Operates machine to compress ingredients into tablets [COMPRESSOR (drug. prep. & rel. prod.; salt production)]. Inspects, weighs, and tests hardness of tablets [TABLET TESTER]. Maybedesignated according to substance prepared as LIQUID COMPOUNDER.

Title: HOT-TOP LINER HELPER
Definition: Assists HOT-TOP LINER in lining covers (hot-tops) for ingot molds: Pries firebrick and clay from inside of cover, using crowbar. Attaches crane hooks to lugs of cover. Cleans mold with oxygen lance. Mixes mortar and carries firebrick to repair platform. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (anyind.).

Title: STRAIGHT-PIN-MAKING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: pinmaker. Sets up and operates battery of automatic machines that straighten, cut off, head, and sharpen wire to form straight (common) pins: Places coil of wire on pedestal stand and threads end of wire through machine to heading dies. Adjusts straightening rolls, feeding arm, and stop to diameter and length of wire, using wrenches. Starts machine and measures sampling of first pins for conformance to specifications, such as length, head diameter, and angle of point to shank, using micrometers and fixed gages. Replaces dull cutters or point- grinding bars, using handtools such as wrenches, screwdrivers, and pliers. Mounts dies in bench lathe and removes burrs and repolishes head cavity, using stick dipped in polishing paste. Empties pin-filled catch pails into tote trays.

Title: FOREMAN, BEAM DEPARTMENT
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in trimming flesh, liming hair, and washing tanned hides. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: SHOP FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in repair of electrical appliances, such as refrigerators, ranges, heaters, washing machines, and ironers, in an electrical repair shop. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: MARKING STITCHER
Definition: Draws thread through several layers of garment parts to mark points for attachment of other parts, using hand powered machine. Places spool of thread on spindle and draws thread through guide and eye of needle. Positions several layers of garment parts on machine bed under needle. Depresses lever that forces needle downward to draw thread through parts, following mar Kingston fabric. Cuts thread between layers of fabric, using scissors, leaving thread through each part to serve as guide for attachment of other parts, such as flaps and pockets.

Title: SCOUT, CHIEF
Definition: scout, senior. Coordinates activities of Scours in obtaining data concerning exploration for and development of oil and gas fields by competitive petroleum companies or individuals. Compiles and correlates data and prepares reports of findings.

Title: SEAMSTRESS
Definition: 781884.mender. Repairs defects, such as tears and holes in garments, linens, curtains, and draperies, and rebinds cleaned blankets by hand or by operating a sewing machine: Patches, darns, or reweaves holes or tears in garments, curtains, or linens, and resews ripped seams. Sews fringe, tassels, and ruffles onto drapes and curtains. Sews buttons and trimming on garments after they have been cleaned. Operates sewing machine to restitch or replace binding ribbon on edge of blankets. May cut curtains to specified measurements and hem edges. May shorten or lengthen hems to alter sire of garments. May replace pockets in coats or trousers. May sew identifying labels and emblems on uniforms, linens, or diapers for linen supply or diaper service. May repair net laundry bags.

Title: PUMP-SERVICEMAN HELPER
Definition: mechanic helper. Assists PUMP SERVICEMAN in repairing pumps, pump power units, and auxiliary equipment: Dismantles pumps, engines, and other machinery, using power hoists and handtools. Arranges tools and working areas to expedite repair and maintenance work. Hauls pump and engine parts to and from machine shops, using hoisting device. Performs other duties as described under HELPER.

Title: RUG CUTTER
Definition: Controls table equipped with electric rotary cutter and other powered equipment to cut rolls of woven fiber rug material to specified lengths: Positions roll in hanger of table, using power hoist. Pulls lever to start power puller that moves material across table. Examines material for flaws and pushes cutter along track to cut out faulty sections. Smooths, squares, and cuts material to make ends even and to avoid waste.

Title: TIRE REPAIRMAN
Definition: tire-and-tube repair man; tire-and-tube serviceman; tire fixer; tire man: tire serviceman. Repairs damaged tires of automobiles, buses, trucks, and other automotive vehicles: Raises vehicle, using hydraulic Jack, and unbolts wheel, using lug wrench. Removes wheel from vehicle by hand or, when repairing giant tires of heavy equipment, by use of power hoist. Locates puncture in tube less tire by visual inspection or by immersing inflated tire in water bath and observing air bubbles emerging from puncture. Seals puncture in tubeless tire by inserting adhesive material and expanding rubber plug into puncture, using handtools. Separates tubed tire from wheel, using rubber mallet and metal bar or mechanical tire changer. Removes inner tube from tire and inspects tire casing for defects, such as holes and tears. Glues boot (tire patch) over rupture in tire casing, using rubber cement. Inflates inner tube and immerses it in water to locate leak. Buffs defective area of inner tube, using scraper, and patches tube withadhesive rubber patch or seals rubber patch to tube, using hot vulcanizing plate. Reassembles tire onto wheel, and places wheel on balancing machine to determine counterweights required to balance wheel. Hammers required counterweights onto rim of wheel. Cleans sides of white wall tires and remounts wheel onto vehicle. Responds to emergency calls to make repairs or replacements of damaged tires at customer's home or on road. May be designated according to specialty as GIANT-TIRE REPAIRMAN; TIRE CHANGER; TIRE CHANGER, ROAD SERVICE.

Title: COLORING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: 582-885.colorman, machine; color-room helper; dyer helper; dye-wheel attendant; laborer, dye-house. Tends one or more tumbling vats to dye felt hat bodies: Dumps hat bodies into perforated tumbler. Pours premixed dye powder into vat and turns valves to admit water and steam to fill and heat vat. Starts tumbler revolving to saturate hat bodies with dye. Adds prescribed chemicals to solution to increase penetration and permanency of dye. Removes dyed articles after specified time.

Title: FORESTER
Definition: Manages and develops forest lands and their resources for economic and recreational purposes: Plans and directs projects in forestation and reforestation. Maps forest areas, estimates standing timber and future growth, and manages timber sales. Plans cutting programs to assure continuous production of timber. Conducts research in methods of cutting and removing timber with minimum waste and damage, and methods of processing wood for various uses. Directs suppression of forest fires and conducts fire-prevention programs. Plans campsites and recreation centers, and directs construction and maintenance of cabins, fences, telephone lines, and roads. Assists in planning and carrying out projects for control of floods, soil erosion, tree diseases, and insect pests in forests [ENTOMOLOGIST; PLANT PATHOLOGIST; SOIL-CONSERVATIONIST]. Advises on forestry problems and conducts educational programs on care of forests. May be designated according to specialty as CONSULTING FORESTER; FOREST EXAMINER; FOREST RANGER; FOREST RECREATIONIST; FOREST SUPERVISOR; RESEARCH FORESTER; TIMBER-MANAGEMENT SPECIALIST.

Title: PONDMAN
Definition: Tends equipment that pumps brine through series of ponds to permit removal of moisture and crystallization of salt by evaporation: Turns valves to open floodgates and fill primary concentration ponds. Tests sample of brine solution to ascertain level of density, using hydrometer. Dilutes brine by pumping it through ponds and into granulator beds, according to specified time sequence. Records hydrometer readings and pumping operations. Pumpe water into granulator beds after salt has been harvested.

Title: ROLL OPERATOR
Definition: A term applied to workers who operate machines to form, forge, bend, or straighten hot or cold metal by passing metal between or under revolving cylinders. Typical classifications are FORMING-ROLL OPERATOR II; ROLL-FORMING-MACHINE OPERATOR II; STRAIGHTENING-ROLL OPERATOR.

Title: TRIM-MACHINE ADJUSTER
Definition: shell-trim toolsetter. Sets up battery of machines that trim small arms cartridge cases and artillery shell cases to specified length: Installs cutters and adjusts stops and cams to regulate machine stroke and synchronize movements of feeding, cutting, and ejection mechanisms, using hand tools. Sharpens dulled cutters and polishes scratched punches, using bench grinder, speed lathe, and emery cloth. Removes housings, guards, feed tubes, chutes, tool holders and other accessories to replace worn or broken parts, such as springs, bushings, and push-rods. May straighten bent punches and machine parts, using hammer and anvil.

Title: ETCHED-CIRCUIT PROCESSOR
Definition: etched-circuit-card fabricator; photoengraver, printed circuits; printed-circuit processor. Prints and etches conductive patterns on copper-faced plastic boards to produce printed circuit boards, using photoengraving and etching equipment: Immerses board in cleaning and degreasing solutions. Sprays light-sensitive enamel on copper surface of board or brushes enamel on board and places board in machine (whirler) that spins board and spreads enamel over board surface. Positions board and circuit negative in contact printer and exposes board to arc light for specified period of time to transfer image of circuit to board. Immerses exposed board in solution to develop acid-resistant circuit pattern on board surface. Examines board to verify development of pattern and brushes acid-resist over sections of pattern not developed. Immerses board in acid or tends etching machine [ETCHER, PRINTED CIRCUITS] to etch conductive pattern in copper surface. Immerses board in solutions to dissolve enamel. May apply heat to developed areas to burn-in developed image, using torch or Bunsen burner. May use silk screen printing machine to apply acid-resist to circuit boards [SILK-SCREEN PRINTER (any ind.)].

Title: ELECTRICIAN, AIRPLANE
Definition: Maintains and repairs airplane electrical equipment, using hand tools: Examines conduits for breaks and weak areas before or after removal from airplane and replaces defective segments. Rewires airplane and arranges wiring and conduits so they do not become entangled or otherwise interfere with fuel lines or other equipment I ELECTRICIAN, AIRPLANE (aircraft mfg.)]. Inspects and tests junction boxes. Tests, repairs, and replaces airplane lighting systems including wiring, running, and landing lights. Does not repair airplane ignition systems [AIRCRAFT- AND- ENGINE MECHANIC (aircraft mfg.; air trans.). Must be licensed by Federal Aviation Agency.

Title: CHEMICAL ENGINEER
Definition: matic measuring devices. Keeps quality control records and prepares technical reports. May specialize in control of computerized processes.

Title: ILLUMINATING ENGINEER
Definition: lighting engineer. Designs lighting equipment and systems: Studies production, measurement, and application of light to obtain optimum performance with the most economical equipment and its proper arrangement: Designs lamps and light-control equipment, such as reflectors and lenses, and measures distribution and output of lamps. Plans installation of lighting systems for buildings, streets, tunnels, fields, and outdoor display. Oversees spacing, mounting, and size of equipment to light adequately objects to be seen and supervises its installation.

Title: INDUCTION-MACHINE SET-UP MAN
Definition: set-up man. Sets up variety of induction machines for INDUCTION-MACHINE OPERATORS to heat- treat metal objects according to specifications: Determines frequency of current, time cycle, and induction beating coil to be used for each Job, using knowledge of induction machines, heat-treating methods, and properties of metals. Positions and fastens induction coil and fixture on machine, using wrenches. Adjusts controls to set frequency of current and automatic timer, judging from color whether pan is heated to specified temperature. Positions and fastens part in fixture and starts machine to heattreat sample part. Tests hardness of sample part [HARDNESS INSPECTOR]. Adjusts frequency of current, automatic timer, and fixture on machine until sample part meets specifications. May operate induction machine as part of regular duties.

Title: CAN PATCHER
Definition: Places rejected can on scale to ascertain amount of off-weight, and adjusts contents to bring to standard weight. Places repacked cans on lidding machine conveyor. May repack contents of cans improperly packed by machine.

Title: INSULATION-WORKER APPRENTICE
Definition: Insulator apprentice. Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: CUPPER AND TINNER
Definition: tinner and capper. Inserts gutters (V-shaped tin pieces) into sifts of trees and nails or wires clay or galvanized iron cups under them to direct flow of and catch resins for making turpentine.

Title: TUCKING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates sewing machine equipped with tucking attachment to fold and sew decorative tucks in fabric of garments: Turns screws to adjust tension of thread, length of stitch, and spacing and width of tucks. (1) Places material over adjustable guide blade and swings blade into position against needle. (2) Moves lever to lower presser foot with attached tucking device and folds material over tucking device and against machine guide beneath needle. Moves lever to look presser foot and tucking device onto material. Trims excess material and thread from tucked article, using scissors or knife-blade attachment. May sew lace or braid in seam of tuck. May be designated according to size of tuck as PIN-TUCK-MACHINE OPERATOR.

Title: GAUZE-PAD-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that forms gauze-covered pads (sanitary pads): Threads gauze, paper, and cotton through feed rollers of machine. Starts machine. Packs finished pads into cartons and places them on conveyor for sealing.

Title: ROLLER MAKER
Definition: Recovers and reconditions used printing-press rollers, using hand- tools and such equipment as melting pot and chopping machine: Strips cover from roller, manually or with knife, separating meltable from nonmeltable materials. Feeds meltable scrap into chopping machine and dumps chopped material into heated melting pot. Weighs out, mixes, and melts ingredients to form molding compound in mixing kettle, according to formula. Paints roller cores, using brush. Winds twine around roller ends and other areas needing packing. Fits stars (centering devices) in position on cores and molding cylinder. Oils cylinder, using oilcan, and inserts cores in cylinder. Attaches bottom plate, water, and drain lines to molding cylinder, using wrenches. Couples lines from compressor to kettle containing molding compound and to pressure gun used to force molding compound into cylinder. Controls flow of compound according to signals from another worker observing operation from raised platform. Pours cold water over surface of cylinder to congeal molding compound. Inspects finished rollers for imperfections, trims excess molding compound from edges, and directs steam over surface of roller covers to remove wrinkles, using steam hose.

Title: STAPLER, HAND
Definition: wire stitcher, hand. Staples padding to both sides of inner- spring or top of box spring assemblies: Places spring assembly on table, spreads leno or sisal cloth over top of springs, and staples to edge wire and tops of spring coils. Spreads padding over cloth, folding edges over edge wire and into coils, and staples to edge wire. Turns inner- spring assembly over to spread and staple cloth and padding to it. May fasten padding to edge wire, using hog rings and pliers. May hand-sew padding to springs. May staple covering to box springs, using hydraulic prees. May staple coil spring assembly to wood frame and be designated STAPLER, COIL UNIT.

Title: CATHETER FINISHER AND INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects and packs rubber surgical tubing for shipment: Verifies outside diameter of tubing with calipers, inserts wire in tubing to detect obstructions, and inspects surface for defects, such as nonfills and cracks. Lays rejected tubing aside for reprocessing. Smooths rough areas on tubing with hand buffing machine. Turns valves to fill rotating drum with specified amounts of chlorine and water, and places tubing in drum for sterilization. Removes tubing after specified time, rinses it with water, and lays it on table to dry.Inserts specified stamp in machine, places tube in machine, and starts machine that prints identifying data on tube. Inserts tube in box and labels box for shipment.

Title: FISHERMAN, WEIR
Definition: fisherman, trap.Constructs weirs (fences) of brush or netting to catch fish: Drives poles and stakes in channels at points of land extending into water, between islands, or in rapids to form circular or heart-shaped enclosure. Fastens stringers and weaves brush or netting horizontally between posts and stakes. Constructs lead of brush to deflect fish into trap. Removes fish from weir with purse seine. This method of fishing is considered illegal in some States, when navigation and conservation are obstructed.

Title: KILN OPERATOR
Definition: dry-kiln operator; kiln foreman. Operates dry kilns to dry lumber to specified moisture content: Directs workers engaged in loading lumber onto kiln cars and placing cars in kilns. Measures moisture content of wood at various locations in kiln, using moisture meter, or by sawing samples of wood, weighing samples before and after drying, and calculating percentage of moisture. Plans drying cycle according to moisture content, dimensions, and species of wood. Sets dials of recording instruments to record temperature and humidity of kilns during drying process. Opens and closes valves to regulate flow of steam into beating pipes or to release steam or water spray into kilns to moisten air. Sets automatic controls to regulate kiln temperature for specified time. Adjusts controls to increase temperature to specified limit while maintaining balance between temperatures and moisture content to avoid damage to wood. Opens kiln at completion of drying cycle and verifies moisture content of wood. Records footage of lumber in kiln, type of wood, and moisture content when entering kiln and when removed. Directs workers engaged in removing lumber from kiln when dried. May hold moisture meter against end of board and read dial to determine moisture content.

Title: DE-ICER-ELEMENT WINDER, MACHINE
Definition: lathe operator. Tends machine that winds wire on to drum to form electric heating elements for airplane deicers: Alines and tapes pre cut sheet of fabric on drum of machine. Determines location of element parts on fabric and length of element wires, using template. Tapes braided wire connections and solders strips to fabric in specified locations.
