Definition: Removes dust or lint with jet of compressed air. Removes lumps from completed chair or sofa cushions by striking cushions with hands or stick.

Title: SALESMAN, FOOD-VENDING SERVICE
Definition: Sells food-vending machine service for items, such as coffee, cold beverages, sandwiches, and candy, to business firms and institutions, utilizing knowledge of food service operation and vending equipment. Performs other duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.).

Title: QUARRY WORKER
Definition: Performs any combination of the following tasks in a rock quarry: Removes mud and muck from surface of stone, using pick, shovel, and steam hose. Chips irregularities from stone slabs to produce uniform, rectangular shapes and reduce shipping weights, using pick. Loosens blasted stone, using pick and crowbar. Cuts notches (dog-holes) in blocks of stone with pick and hammer, and attaches hoisting cables, hooks, or slings to stone. Breaks stone into pieces, using sledge hammer. Loads broken rock into boxes to be hoisted from quarry, using shovel, stone fork, or hands. Loosens blasted stone with bar or pick and skids rock into position for breaking. May be known according to specific task performed as Box LOADER; MUCKER I.

Title: CHALK-EXTRUDING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends automatic extruding machine and cutter that extrude and cut to length chalk billets: Loads billet into extrusion die, locks die in place, and starts machine that automatically forces billet through die onto cutting table. Places extruded chalk under cutter and depresses pedal to cut to specified length.

Title: CONCRETE-PIPE MAKER
Definition: poured- pipe maker. Performs any combination of following tasks involved in casting concrete pipe and manholes: Moves overhead crane to position steel mold sections and reinforcing cage on pallet, and to insert mold core and pouring plate. Fastens mold sections together, using wrenches to tighten screw clamps and bolts and nuts. Inserts pins through apertures in mold to form holes in casting for insertion of hoisting bar. Brushes or sprays mold and core with oil to prevent concrete from adhering. Positions concrete-filled pouring bucket over pouring plate on top of mold, using hoist. Strikes trip bar of bucket to release concrete onto pouring plate and into mold. Bolts pneumatic vibrator to mold, using wrench, and starts vibrator to settle concrete in mold. Places steam hoses inside filled mold, lowers curing box over mold with hoist or covers mold with canvas, and turns valves to admit steam to cure concrete. Dismantles mold and core after concrete has cured. Inserts and cements metal ladder rungs into precast holes inside manholes. May be designated according to task performed as CAGE TIER; FORM OILER; FORM STRIPPER AND ASSEMBLER; VIBRATOR MAN.

Title: INSTRUCTOR, NAVIGATION
Definition: Teaches small boat navigation, handling, and piloting: Instructs boatowners and operators in celestial navigation, dead reckoning, boat piloting, and marine transporTATION RULES, BY LECTURE AND USE OF NAVIGATING AND PILOTING INSTRUMENTS AND MODELS.

Title: DRIER OPERATOR
Definition: Operates rotary drier to reduce moisture content in wood chips, and tests finished particle board for conformance to specifications: Collects sample of chips, weighs sample before and after drying, computes weight of moisture removed from chips, and converts weight to percentage, using mathematical tables. Turns thermostat to set temperature drier according to air humidity and moisture content of chips. Pushes or pulls electric switches to ignite furnace and start drier, fans, and pneumatic conveyor. Alters drier temperature to compensate for moisture content of each batch of chips. Weighs sample of finished particle board on scales to determine density of board. Measures thickness of board with micrometer. Determines tensile strength of board by placing sample between holders of testing machines and turning handwheel that applies force necessary to rupture sample. Records test results.

Title: SAW FILER
Definition: filer. Repairs band- saw, handsaw, and circular saw blades according to customer's or manufacturer's specifications, using hand- tools, machine tools, and welding equipment: Examines saw for defects. Cuts broken teeth from saw, using power shear [SHEAR OPERATOR I]. Forms teeth on saw blade by beveling joints on grinder and welding or brazing them together. Brazes or welds cracks in saw blades. Straightens twists and kinks in blades, using straightening press, and hammers out dents in blade on metal table. Adjusts cutting width of teeth, using swage or special pliers. Computes number and angle of teeth that will produce specified cut. Clamps blade in saw-filing machine and turns handwheel to adjust distance between teeth, angle of bevel, and depth of cut of file or abrasive wheel. Starts machine that automatically grinds and files saw teeth. May be designated according to type of saw sharpened as BAND-SAW FILER; CIRCULAR-SAW FILER.

Title: DRY CLEANER
Definition: Tends cleaning machine and drier that deans and dries knitted garments: Examines garment for soil and determines type of soil. Lays garment on cleaning board with spotted surface exposed. Applies soap solvent to spot with brush and removes excess soap with towel. Opens valve to admit cleaning fluid to tank of washing machine. Lays spotted garment in machine and starts machine. Stops machine, removes garment, and places it in drier. Removes garment from drier and hangs it on hook in clothes room. Turns on fan in clothes room to drive cleaning fluid fumes from clothes. Removes garment from clothes room.

Title: MANAGER, FRONT OFFICE
Definition: hotel manager; manager, office. Coordinates front-office activities of hotel and resolves problems arising from guests' complaints, reservation and room assignment activities, and unusual requests and inquiries: Assigns duties and shifts to workers and observes their activities to insure adherence to hotel policies and established operating procedures. Confers and cooperates with other department heads to insure coordination of hotel activities. Answers inquiries pertaining to hotel policies and services. Greets important guests. Arranges for private telephone line and other special services. May patrol public rooms, investigate disturbances, and warn troublemakers. May interview and hire applicants.

Title: EMPLOYEE-OPERATIONS EXAMINER
Definition: rules examiner; systems-rules examiner. Interprets and explains railroad rules, regulations, and procedures to railroad employees to keep them abreast of additions, deletions, and amendments. Conducts classroom discussions to encourage employee participation. May administer and grade promotional examinations.

Title: SUPERVISOR, LIQUOR STORES AND ADENCIES
Definition: Directs activities of alcoholic beverage control authority in states operating retail liquor stores: Coordinates, through subordinates, purchasing, sale, inventory control, display, tabulating of receipts, and warehousing of beverages in stores according to public demand and established policy of control authority. Visits stores to inspect facilities and procedures and evalute condition of stock. Authorizes transfer of beverages among stores to maintain fresh, balanced stock. Recommends expansion, remodeling, or relocation of stores according to accepted merchandising principles and policy of authority. Reviews sales and inventory reports to develop more efficient procedures and to supply data on beverage consumption to legislative officials or other interested parties. May plan window displays or other merchandising techniques to stimulate sales.

Title: CLEARICAL TECHNICIAN
Definition: methods man. Studies clerical and statistical methods in commercial or industrial establishments to develop improved and standardized procedures: Consults supervisors and clerical workers to ascertain functions of offices or sections, methods used, and personnel requirements. Prepares reports on procedures and tasks of individual workers. Makes recommendations for improvements by introduction of new forms, modifications of existing procedures, or some other method. May gather data and prepare statistical reports for promotional and incentive purposes [STATISTICAL CLERK (clerical)]. May write training manuals and conduct training conferences in new procedures. May write Job descriptions and specifications [JOB ANALYST].

Title: KETTLEMAN, GOLD
Definition: fireman. Tends series of oil-fired kettles that refine lead: Charges kettle with lead in molten or pig form, and fires kettle. Adds specified type and amount of reagent and agitates mixture to cause impurities, such as antimony, arsenic, bismuth, and tin to form into dross. Skims dross off mixture, using ladle, shovel, or perforated dipper. Throws zinc bricks into kettle and agitates mixture to desilverize lead. Skims crust of silver and gold content into basket of press, and compresses dross with air- driven ram. Pumps lead through reaction cylinder while chlorine is admitted to form zinc chloride dag. Skims slag after completion of reaction as indicated by color of slag and molten metal. Pours metal into molds or dips samples into cold water to prepare them for laboratory analysis. May hook pot to crane and signal ELECTRIC- BRIDGE- OR- GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to transfer lead from one kettle to another. May crystallize zinc in water-cooled vacuum tank to remove zinc from desilverized lead. May produce antimony crystals from antimonial lead by mixing prescribed reagents with molten metal in kettle, by skimming dross, and by cooling bath to specified temperature. May be known according to specific tasks performed as

Title: ELECTRONIC ENGINEER
Definition: Conducts research and development concerned with design and manufacture of vacuum and gaseous tubes, semiconductor and other solid-state devices, and electronic equipment, and their application to commercial, industrial, military, scientific and medical equipment, processes, and problems: Designs electrical circuits to spcifications, utilizing ferroelectric, nonlinear, dielectric, phosphor, photoconductive, and thermoelectric properties of materials [DESIGN ENGINEER I]. Designs test apparatus and devises procedures to evaluate electronic equipment. Develops improved utilization of electric and dielectric properties of metallic and non metallic materials used in electronic components. May specialize in applications of electronic technology, such as telecommunications, telemetering, aerospace guidance systems, missile propulsion control, counter measures, acoustics, nucleonic instrumentation, electronic data reduction and processing equipment, industrial controls and measurements, high-frequency beating, laboratory techniques, teaching aids, radiation detection, encephalography, electron optics, and biomedical research. May direct field operation and maintenance of electronic equipment and recommend design changes according to operational evaluation to correct errors or to accommodate changes in system requirements. May be designated according to specialization as ENGINEER, INSTRUMENTATION; SYSTEMS ENGINEER; THERMIONIC ENGINEER.

Title: PLANISHER
Definition: Flattens previously initialed heads of signet rings to remove dents, using press: Positions plunger and arbor holder in press. Slips ring on arbor and inserts arbor in arbor holder. Pushes lever that forces plunger down on head of ring to flatten it and remove dents. Releases lever and removes ring from press.

Title: FLOOR-MAT JUTER
Definition: Inspects rubber automobile floor mats and cements jute pad to underside of mat to form resilient backing: Examines face of mat for damage or defects, such as bubbles, boles, tears, or puckering. Removes partially-cut rubber blanks from holes to accommodate brake, clutch, and accelerator pedals. Brushes cement onto underside of mat and presses jute backing onto coated area. Rejects damaged or defective mats and stacks satisfactory units for shipment or installation.

Title: ASTRONOMER
Definition: Observes and interprets celestial phenomena and relates research to basic scientific knowledge or to practical problems, such as navigation: Studies celestial phenomena by means of optical and radio telescopes, equipped with such devices as cameras, spectrometers, radiometers, photometers, and micrometers, which may either be on ground or carried above atmosphere with balloons, rockets, or satellites. Interprets information obtained in terms of basic physical laws. Determines sizes, shapes, brightness, spectra, and motions, and computes positions of sun, moon, planets, stars, nebulas, and galaxies. Calculates orbits or various celestial bodies. Determines exact time by celestial observations, and conducts research into relationships between time and space. Develops mathematical tables giving positions of sun, moon, planets, and stars at given times for use by sir and sea navigators. Conducts research on statistical theory of motions of celestial bodies. Analyzes wave lengths of radiation from celestial bodies, as observed in optical and radio ranges of spectrum. Studies history, structure, extent, and evolution of stars, stellar systems, and universe. May design new and improved optical, mechanical, and electronics Instruments for astronomical research. May specialize in study of temperature, luminosity, and chemical composition of celestial bodies, and be known as ASTROPHYSICIST. May study motions of objects in solar system in relation to action of gravitation, and calculate orbits of artificial satellites and paths of guided missiles, and be known as ASTRONOMER, CELESTIAL MECHANICS. May specialize in measuring coordinates of celestial bodies, and be known as ASTROMETRIC. May study sources, nature, and origin of celestial radio waves by means of radio telescopes, and be known as RADIO ASTRONOMER.

Title: TREE PRUNER
Definition: pruner; tree trimmer.Cuts away dead and excess branches from fruit, nut, and shade trees: Prunes trees with handsaws, pruning hooks and shears, and long-handled clippers, or by using truck equipped with hydraulic lifts, hydraulic pruners, and power pruners. Applies tar or other protective substances to cut surfaces to seal them against insects. Climbs trees, using climbing hooks and belts, or uses ladders to gain access to work area. May specialize in removing dead branches or excess wood from fruit trees and be designated as ORCHARD PRUNER.

Title: BARREL INSPECTOR
Definition: see INSPECTOR, WATCH PARTS II.

Title: INJECTION-MOLDING-MACHINE  OFF-BEARER
Definition: molding-machine operator. Removes barrels of fountain pens, ballpoint pens, and mechanical pencils from discharge outlet of injection- molding machine. Inspects barrel for defects. Places completed barrels in container. Opens gate of machine, removes runners from mold, and dumps them into grinder.

Title: PARASITOLOGIST
Definition: Studies characteristics, habits, and life cycles of animal parasites, such as protozoans, tapeworms, roundworms, liver flukes, mites, ticks, and parasitic insects, to determine manner in which they attack human beings and animals and effects produced. Investigates modes of transmission from host to host. Develops methods and agents with which to combat parasites or treat infections. May specialize in study of one variety of parasite or in development of drug and chemical agents for parasite control. May specialize In study and control of animal parasites that attack man and be designated MEDICAL PARA- OTOLOGIST.

Title: FALES-MACHINE-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: quilting-machine helper. Performs any combination of following tasks in making padding: Carries or trucks bats, burlap, and size to machines, lifts bats to feed holder of fales machine, and fills tanks with size. Laps gauze over pads, using rod. Stamps identification on pads. Removes finished pads or waste from conveyor and piles in boxes. May assist operators to set up machine.

Title: FOREMAN, BLAST FURNACE
Definition: blower, blast furnace. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in operation of blast furnace to produce molten pig iron: Directs workers in charging furnace with specified amounts of raw materials, such as iron ore, coke, and limestone. Observes color of molten metal through tuyeres, or reads pyrometer and orders changes in furnace temperature and pressure. Estimates amounts of ferrosilicon, manganese, and phosphorous to add to molten metal to obtain specified type of pig iron. Directs workers in flashing and tapping furnace and in positioning ladles to receive molten metal. Observes color of molten metal flowing in runners during casting operations to determine quality of iron. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: ABLE SEAMAN
Definition: able-bodied seaman. Performs the fallowing tasks on board ship: Stands watch at bow or on wing of bridge to look for obstructions in path of vessel. Measures depth of water in shallow or unfamiliar waters, using leadline, and telephones or shouts Information to bridge. Turns wheel on bridge or use emergency steering apparatus to steer vessel as directed by MATE. Breaks out, rigs, overhauls, and stows cargo-handling gear, stationary rigging, and running gear. Overhauls lifeboats and lifeboat gear and lowers or raises lifeboats with wind) or falls. Paints and chips rust on deck or superstructure of ship. Must hold certificate issued by the Government. When working aboard vessels carrying liquid cargoes, must hold a tankerman certificate. May stow or remove cargo from ship's hold [LONGSHOREMAN II]. May be concerned with only one particular phase of duties, as maintenance of ship's gear and decks or watch duties, and be known as DECK-MAINTENANCE MAN; WATCH-STANDER.

Title: LIGHTKEEPER, TRIANGULATION
Definition: signalman. Positions and adjusts light, mirror, or electronic signal equipment used in surveying by triangulation to establish angles and elevations: Climbs hills, towers, or other elevations as directed to position signals. Communicates with observer at distant point by radio or by hand or light signals, to verify correct functioning of signals prior to taking of angles for recording purposes. Observes light and mirror signals from distant points, using field glasses, to establish angles and elevations in designated areas.

Title: CHEESE CUTTER
Definition: Tends machine that cuts blocks of cheese into pieces of specified shape and size: Examines cheese for defects in color, texture, and body. Bolts specified cutting head to machine, using wrench, adjusts stops on cutting table, and turns wheels to position cutting wires. Places block on table, and moves lever to lower cutting bead or raise table to cut cheese. Weighs cut cheese, places pieces on conveyor, and records amount cut. May measure cheese with ruler and cut with hand cutter. May trim rind, mold, or sediment from cheese, using knife.

Title: BAGGER
Definition: Covers laundered and drycleaned clothing or household articles with plastic or paper bags by any of the following methods: (1) Hangs garment or article on stand and slides paper bag over it. (2) Pulls plastic from rolls, sliding plastic material over article and tearing plastic at perforations to form bag of desired size. (3) Hangs garment on holder in machine and pulls plastic from roll to envelop garment. Pushes button or moves lever to close heating irons that cut and seal plastic to form bag of desired dimensions. Hangs bagged article on slide rail or rack. (4) Drops shirts or folded articles into machine that automatically envelops them in plastic bags and drops them into box. Removes boxes from beneath machine when filled and replaces them with empty boxes.

Title: GLASS-BULB SILVERER
Definition: Coats interiors of ornamental glass balls with silvering solution: Pours solution into balls through small openings. Holds stopper over openings and shakes balls until interior surfaces are covered. Pours surplus silvering solution out of balls.

Title: CHALK-CUTTING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Loads lengths of extruded chalk into die, locks die In place, and runs hand cutter through holes in die to out chalk to specified lengths. Opens die, places cut chalk In trays for drying, and disposes of excess chalk.

Title: SUPERINTENDENT, GENERATION
Definition: nance and repair work. Coordinates plant shutdowns for emergency and periodic inspection and repair. Supervises testing and analyzes such test data as heat input, heat output, and boiler and turbine efficiency, to evaluate capability and efficiency of generating stations. Directs activities of maintenance crews servicing scattered generating stations. May direct operation of substations and transmission lines (SUPERINTENDENT, TRANSMISSION].

Title: PATHOLOGIST
Definition: medical pathologist. Studies nature, cause, and development of diseases, and structural and functional changes caused by them: Diagnoses, from body tissue, fluids, secretions, and other specimens, presence and stage of disease, utilizing laboratory procedures. Acts as consultant to other medical practitioners. Performs autopsies to determine nature and extent of disease, cause of death, and effects of treatment. May direct activities of pathology department in medical school, hospital, clinic, medical examiner's office, or research institute. May be designated according to speciality as CLINICAL PATHOLOGIST; FORENSIC PATHOLOGIST; NEUROPATHOLOGIST; SURGICAL PATHOLOGIST.

Title: INSPECTOR, MATERIAL TEST
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers in the material-testing department of an aircraft company: Oversees testing of materials for hardness. Supervises workers making tests on metal, fabric, or other materials. Stamps approval on reports of materials tested and found satisfactory. Makes out rejection slips on unsatisfactory materials and refers them to purchasing department. Prepares reports to engineering department on materials that do not meet specifications but might be adapted to other uses.

Title: OUTBOARD-MOTOR INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects outboard motors at end of assembly line for conformance to factory standards, preparatory to shipment: Examines motor for missing parts, dents, scratches, and paint imperfections, such as runs and spots. Moves shifting lever into drive positions, pulls starter rope, opens cover latches and doors, moves tilt lever, release lever, starter look, and reverse lock to verify operation ot parts. Records defects on Inspection tag.

Title: HONING-MACHINE OPERATOR, PRODUCTION
Definition: cylinder boner; honer; honing- machine operator, semiautomstic: production-honing-machine operator. Operates and maintains setup of one or more previously set-up honing machines to hone internal or external surfaces of metal parts, such as cylinders, bearings, and connecting rods, to specifications, usually on a production basis: Obtains such Information as dimensions, tolerances, and number of parts in run from job order and instructions of MACHINE- SHOP FOREMAN, PRODUCTION or HONING-MACHINE SET-UP MAN. Lifts workpiece manually or with hoist and secures it in fixture. Starts machine and turns hand wheels or engages automatic mechanism to feed tool to workpiece. Moves controls to adjust feed rate, spindle speed, length of stroke, and depth of cut. Measures finished workpiece with instruments, such as calipers, fixed gages, and micrometers. Changes worn tools, using wrenches. May read blueprints. May assist HONING-MACHINE SET-UP MAN to set up machine. May be required to have experience with particular material or product, or with machine of particular size, type, or trade name, and be designated accordingly.

Title: LAWYER, ADMIRALTY
Definition: Specializes in law applicable to matters occurring on inland navigable waters or on the high seas: Conducts lawsuits in matters involving seamen, ship collisions, matters of cargo, and damage to objects by vessels. Draws legal documents including charter parties, applications for registry of vessels under flags of a particular country, and bills of sale for vessels. Determines law applicable by study of the Constitution, statutes, previous decisions, and regulations. Advises clients as to advisability of prosecuting and defending a lawsuit or as to legal rights and obligations in other matters.

Title: PULLER-OVER, MACHINE
Definition: Stretches toe, vamp, and quarters of shoe upper over sides of last and tacks upper onto insole and bottom of fast, using pull-over machine: Positions lasted upper on machine. Pulls lever to stretch upper over last. Pushes second lever to clamp upper in position and depresses pedal to start tacking operation.

Title: SHOT POLISHER AND INSPECTOR
Definition: Tends equipment in shot tower that segregates, routes, blends, and polishes shot (lead pellets) used in shotgun shells: Starts bucket elevator that conveys newly formed pellets up shot tower and into screening drums that remove oversize and undersize pellets. Turns crank to adjust angle of glass plates over which screened shot is rolled to remove out-of-round pellets, using measuring stick graduated in shot sizes to verify pitch. Pulls levers and chains to direct flow of shot into sieves, polishing barrel, and storage bins, or into scrap bin for remelting. Connects Y-pipe between specified bins and polishing barrel, starts barrel rotating, and opens bin valves to blend full- and off-size shot by flowing them together in Y-pipe. Weighs sample of mixed shot at designated intervals and counts total number of pellets in sample, using pellet counting plate. Measures size of pellets, using pellet measuring stick, and counts number of each size to determine average size. Rolls pellets under dial micrometer to ascertain roundness. Turns valves by trial and error to obtain shot blend that conforms to specifications. Records results of tests.

Title: SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR
Definition: powerhouse attendant Controls powerhouse equipment, such as converters, rectifiers, transformers, and generators, to direct, distribute, and maintain power to chemical processing equipment, according to demand: Moves switches on central control panel to regulate converters and rectifiers to convert alternating current or direct current and transmit it to electrolytic cell department, according to production demand. Observes demand meters, gages, and recording instruments and moves controls to insure efficient power utilization, equipment operation, and maintain power distribution, according to departmental demands. Monitors gages, alarms, and oscilloscopes to detect and prevent damage to equipment and disruption of power. Records operational data, such as chart and meter readings, power demand and usage, malfunctions and repairs, and operating time. Cleans, lubricates, repairs, and adjusts equipment, using hand tools, May turn valves to regulate pressure on lines drawing chlorine to electrolytic cells. When controlling specific equipment only, may be designated by unit as MOTOR-GENERATOR-SET OPERATOR; RECTIFIER OPERATOR.

Title: CHANGE-HOUSE MAN
Definition: dry boss dry janitor; dry man; wash-house nan. Maintains building, such as locker room of golf dub, change house of mining camp, or shower facilities of industrial plant, in which patrons or workers shower and change clothes: Sweeps floor and scrubs shower stalls, using broom, brushes, and soap and water. Opens windows to control ventilation or adjusts controls of automatic heating, cooling, or dehumidifying unit to maintain healthful and comfortable conditions. May fire boiler to heat water for bathing or heating facility. May requisition and issue supplies, such as soap, towels, and protective clothing.

Title: SMOKING-PIPE REPAIRMAN
Definition: Operates lathe to repair pipes and cigar and cigarette holders according to customer's specifications: Fits rubber or plastic mouthpiece blank in lathe chuck. Guides tools against revolving blank to drill and ream airhole and to turn end of blank to fit pipe or holder. Carves blank with scraper or presses blank against grinding and buffing wheel to shape mouthpiece according to customer's specifications. Heats pipe stem over flame to bend stem to specified angle. Cuts threads on stem and pipe shank, using tap and die. Repairs broken or cracked shanks with cement, metal bands, or screws.

Title: BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: boring-machine operator. multiple spindle. Sets up and operates single or multiple spindle boring machine to bore holes In wooden parts: Examines blueprints, drawings, or samples and written specifications to ascertain size, type, and setting of boring tools, stops, Jigs, and guides to be used. Selects boring tools and accessories and Installs them in machine, using rule and wrenches. Adjusts spindle locations and stops to regulate spacing and depth of bore, using rule or template and wrenches, or turns hand wheels to move table and guides to center stock under bits and regulate depth of bore. Starts machine, places stock on table against guides, and moves lever or depresses pedal to engage wood stock with rotating bits. Verifies location and depth of holes, using rule, template, or by fitting parts together. May be designated according to machine operated as BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, DOUBLE END; BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, HORIZONTAL; BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, VERTICAL; CLUSTER-BORE OPERATOR; GANG-BORE OPERATOR.

Title: MIXING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that mixes food ingredients for subsequent processing and canning: Loads hopper of mixer with pre measured quantities of ingredients by hand, conveyor, bucket hoist, or by opening valves. Starts mixer and observes operation to insure thorough blending. Pulls lever to tilt and empty mixer or uses scoop to empty mixture into chute, hopper, or container. May weigh out and measure ingredients, using platform scale and measuring containers. May observe and control conveyors and filling machines in processing line to insure continuous operation.

Title: SUTURE WINDER, HAND
Definition: gut winder. Winds single or multiple lengths of surgical catgut into fiber suture reel: Pulls out holding flaps on reel, inserts end of strand under one flap, and places reel on power-driven wheel. Presses pedal to actuate wheel and guides strand under holding flaps as wheel spins, winding pre cut lengths, or measuring lengths by counting wheel revolutions. When winding numerous strands, turns reels by hand. Cuts catgut from spool, using scissors. Inserts completed reels in plastic envelopes for subsequent sterilization, or into glass tubes for future use.

Title: SORTER
Definition: Sorts material into specified sequence or group for purposes, such as filing, mailing, copying data from one record to another, and preparing reports: Sorts items, such as forms, checks, receipts, bills, sales tickets, and correspondence according to addresses, codes, quantity, class, or other prescribed methods. May be designated according to work performed as BILL SORTER; SALES-SUP SORTER.

Title: TICKET-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates machine to print identifying information such as model, shade, size, and lot on tags or tickets: Selects and positions specified type in printing roller of machine with fingers or tweezers. Turns setscrew with fingers to lock type in roller. Counts quantity of tags specified. Positions single tag or strip of tags between feed rollers or on feed bed, and turns crank to power printing roller and bed or roller feed of machine, printing tags. Applies ink to inking roller with brush or spatula. May sew tags onto garments or garment parts.

Title: BRAIDING-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: Tends battery of machines that braid and cement fabric cord or wire around rubber hose for reinforcement: Threads machine with specified spools of cord, rubber insulation, or wire stock. Notifies BALL-UP MAN when change in pitch gear is required. Pulls hose from reel and threads it into braiding machine. Adjusts controls to maintain uniform tension on cord or wire stock. Starts flow of rubber cement into machine and starts machine. Observes operation for defects, such as broken cords and loose braiding. Ties broken cords. Places braided hose on stock rack or coils it in box. May rewind partial spools of cord to make full spool, using electric windup spindle. May tend machine that knits yarn onto rubber hose and be designated KNITTING- MACHINE TENDER. May tend one or more looms that weave yarn and wire jacket around hose and be designated LOOM OPERATOR.

Title: ALKYLATION  TOWERMAN
Definition: Tends semiautomatic acid contactors (reactors), debutanizers, deisobutanizers, depropanizers, and fractionation towers to facilitate production of alkylates (saturated isoparaffins) used in high-octane gasolines.

Title: INSPECTOR, GAGE
Definition: gage checker. Inspects and adjusts gages, measuring instruments, and testing equipment for conformance to blueprint specifications: Verifies accuracy of gages and measuring instruments, such as dial indicators, fixed gages, height gages, and electrical and functional gages, using master gages or master parts. Examines gages or measuring instruments for wear or adjustment. Disassembles inaccurate or worn gages and measuring instruments with handtools. Inspects parts for wear, warping, or other defects. Verifies dimensions of parts against blueprint specifications, using gage blocks, micrometer, vernier height gage, sine bar, and bevel protractor. Computes unspecified dimensions and other data, using shop mathematics and trigonometry. Laps corroded or pitted surfaces. Reassembles gage and adjusts stops and levers to specified settings. Inspects accuracy of new gages and instruments for conformance to blueprint specifications before they are released for production use.

Title: FURNACE-STOCK INSPECTOR
Definition: baked-and-graphite inspector. Determines density and resistance of carbon samples which have been graphitized and inspects graphitized stock after removal from furnace: (1) Marks samples of green stock before graphitization to indicate their position in furnace. Receives samples from FURNACE UNLOADER before rest of charge is unloaded. Cleans samples with scraper and steel wool and weighs them. Obtains average diameter of samples by measuring in several pieces with diameter rule. Places samples on resistance-testing device, sets meter to allow given number of amperes to pass through sample, and records readings from millivoltmeter. Calculates average density and average resistance from weight, average diameter, and millivolt reading, using slide rule and formula. (2) When furnace is unloaded, marks pieces with resistance grade number of samples. Inspects cleaned stock for pits, cracks, burrs, and bends. Determines extent of damage from cracks and imperfections and marks salvageable pieces for cutting to nextlargest possible size. Directs workers to remove inspected pieces.

Title: DIRECTOR, RESEARCH
Definition: technical adviser. Directs research activities of HISTORIANS, DRAMATIC ARTS (profess. & kin.), and researches data regarding customs and characteristics of race or type of people, manners of speech, architectural styles peculiar to specific localities, periods, and historical events in motion pictures. Advises DIRECTOR, ART and PRODUCER concerning historical details of subjects being photographed or recorded. Keeps library of encyclopedias, reference books, and historical, technical, and pictorial works. Directs classification and filing of research materials.

Title: STEAMER TENDER
Definition: doth steamer; cottage steamer; pressure-steamer tender; steamer finisher; turner-steamer tender. Tends pressurized, steam-heated chambers to age dyed or printed cloth or to set pile in pile fabrics: Hangs cloth in loops on carriages or racks by pulling cloth over rod of carriage or by hooking cloth selvages at intervals on rack hooks. Pushes doth carriages or racks into steamer and bolts door, using wrench. Turns valve to admit steam into steaming chamber. Pulls carriages or racks from steamer after specified time. May tend miniature steamer to steam samples and be designated as PATCH-STEAMER TENDER.

Title: CASEY-SAW OPERATOR
Definition: Operates portable circular saw to cut out detail openings and defects in doors: Selects and installs saw disk on machine shaft according to width and type of cut required. Positions template frame on door in line with cut to be made. Places machine on template track, starts saw, and pushes machine along track to make cut, regulating depth of cut by lever control, according to opening or type of defect. May operate machine to cut grooves in cabinet parts.

Title: GAS-MASK ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembles military gas masks, using kick press and handtools: Punches holes in face piece, using kick press. Attaches valves to face piece and seals joints, using wire strands, acetone, cement, and tape. Glues hoses to face piece and canister units. Clinches metal clamps on strips of tape to form head harness and attaches harness to mask. Inserts lenses in eyepieces and crimps rims to seal them. May stitch reinforcement patches onto masks and seal stitching with cement. May be designated according tc specific work as KICK-PRESS OPERATOR, GAS MASKS; TAPER; TIP CLINCHER; VALVE SEALER; WIRER.

Title: CAR CARDER
Definition: Removes and replaces advertising cards in public conveyances, such as streetcars and buses. May dean interior and exterior of buses [CLEANER III (any ind.)].

Title: CENTRAL-SUPPLY WORKER
Definition: central- supply eld. Cleans, sterilizes, and assembles hospital equipment, supplies, and instruments accord- in to prescribed procedures and techniques, performing any combination of following tasks: Scrubs and washes surgical instruments, containers, rubber gloves, and syringes and equipment, such as aspirators, croupettes, and oxygen suppliers. Sterilizes instruments, equipment, surgical linens, and supplies, such as surgical packs, treatment trays, rubber gloves, and syringes, using autoclave, water sterilizer, or antiseptic solutions. Prepares packs of supplies and instruments, and dressing and treatment trays, according to designated lists or codes, and wraps, labels, and seals them. Sharpens hypodermic needles, using hone or abrasive wheel, and matches syringe barrels and plungers, according to sise, trade name, or serial number. Examines rubber gloves far leaks or deterioration and patches hole. Powders, sizes, mates, and wraps groves in paper or cloth preparatory to sterilizing. Stores prepared articles and supplies in designated areas. May fill requisitions, write charges, and inventory supplies. May prepare solutions according to prescribed formula. May be assigned to such hospital rooms as surgery and delivery rooms. May be required to hold Practical Nurse license.

Title: TEACHER, BLIND
Definition: instructor, blind; teacher, braille. Teaches elementary and secondary school subjects to blind pupils, using braille system: Instructs pupils in reading and writing braille, using slate and stylus or braille writer. Adapts school curriculum to meet needs of pupil, teaching subjects, such as mental arithmetic and music listening. Trams pupils to recognize objects and perform useful duties by developing their sense of touch. May teach braille to persons with sight and be designated as INSTRUCTOR, BRAILLE.

Title: HEAN WELDER, ELRCTRIC-WELD PIPER MILL
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in making tubing from flat steel strips (skelp) by electric-weld process. Analyzes magnaflux and hydrostatic tests, observes welding processes to determine quality of product, and directs workers in making adjustments to welding unit, rolls, rotary shear, and straightener. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: STEWARD, CHIEF, PASSENGER SHIP
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of personnel in steward's department aboard passenger vessel: Supervises workers engaged in housekeeping and meal serving. Arranges space for shipboard recreation activities. Inspects passenger areas for cleanliness. Observes services rendered by steward personnel for conformance to company standards. Collaborates with CHEF, PASSENGER VESSEL to plan menus. Requisitions stores, such as food, sundries, and furniture. Orders replacements for personnel leaving ship.

Title: MODELER
Definition: Molds from plaster of paris original models for special designs in decorative tile, such as fountains and waterspouts, sculpturing the model by cutting, scraping, and finishing. May supervise MOLD MAKER (brick & tile; conc. prod.) in preparing wooden molds from original models.

Title: FILTRATION OPERATOR, POLYETHYLENE CATALYST
Definition: Controls rotary-leaf filters and such auxiliary equipment as centrifuges, pumps, compressors, heat exchangers, and conveyors to remove process catalyst from polyethylene products: Starts pumps, centrifuges, and compressors. Observes gages and chart recorders, turns valves, and sets automatic control Instruments to regulate temperatures, pressures, flow rates, and liquid levels within plant specifications, and to transfer materials between units to insure efficient removal of catalyst. Directs other workers engaged in tending pumps, compressors, and centrifuges and in making manual adjustments to equipment to maintain required process conditions. Moves manual and automatic controls to switch filters into and out of service for replacement of diatomaceous-earth coating. Records instrument readings and laboratory test results in operating log. Inspects equipment for malfunctions, wear, and leaks, reporting need for repairs to maintenance personnel.

Title: FORMING-MACHINE-UPKEEP-MAN HELPER
Definition: shear boy; spare boy. Assists FORMING-MACHINE UPKEEP-MAN in setting up and repairing bottle-forming machines and lubricates feeder chutes and molds: Removes and replaces glass-forming molds and components and adjusts shears and orifice rings (furnace channel opening), according to instructions, using handtools. Swabs or brushes feeder chutes and molds with oil or compound to prevent molten glass from sticking. Lubricates machine parts, using oilcan. Transfers molds to and from mold repair shop, using handtruck. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: DESKMAN, BOWLING FLOOR
Definition: floor man. Assigns bowling alleys to patrons and collects fees: Reserves alleys for bowling league or individuals. Issues score sheets and alley numbers to patrons. Inspects alleys to insure that bowling equipment is available. Observes players to determine misuse of alleys or other equipment. Records number of games played and receipts collected. Rents bowling shoes to patrons. May assign PIN BOYS to work station and record their work time.

Title: DIRECTOR, FOOD AND BEVERAGE
Definition: maitre d'hotel. Coordinates activities of workers engaged in preparing food and beverages in hotel or chain of hotels or restaurants to insure profitable food service: Plans dining room, bar, and banquet operations, and establishes food policies and type of service to be offered. Analyzes cost records and data, such as procurement, preparation, and sales of food and beverages, to ascertain distribution of costs among various departments. Establishes food and beverage prices and payroll costs. Analyzes market conditions and investigates acceptability of substitute food products in order to control food costs. Supervises, through subordinates, workers engaged in preparing and serving food and beverages.

Title: SHIPFITTER
Definition: fitter. Lays out and fabricates metal structural parts, such as plates, bulkheads, and frames, and braces them in position within hull of ship for riveting or welding: Lays out position of parts on metal, working from blueprints or templates and using scribe and handtools. Locates and marks reference lines, such as centerlines, buttock lines, and frame lines. Positions parts in hull of ship, assisted by RIGGER. Alines parts in relation to each other, using jacks, turnbuckles, clips, wedges, and mauls. Marks location of holes to be drilled and installs temporary fasteners to hold part in place for welding or riveting. Installs packing, gaskets, liners, and structural accessories and members, such as doors, hatches, brackets, and clips. May prepare molds and templates for fabrication of nonstandard parts. May tack weld clips and brackets in place prior to permanent welding. May roll, bend, flange, cut, and shape plates, beams, and other heavy metal parts, using shop machinery, such as plate rolls, presses, bending brakes, and Joggle machines.

Title: GARTER INSERTER
Definition: Hang sends of straps, to which garters have been attached, onto loops on knitted undergarments.

Title: LINEMAN
Definition: Installs and repairs telephone and telegraph lines (wires and cables) according to diagrams, and using electricians' handtools: Ascends poles or enters tunnels and sewers to cut in feeder lines, attach appliances, such as terminal boxes and repeaters, and repair or replace defective lines and auxiliary equipment. Unreels and strings lines from pole to pole and from pole to building, installs hardware, such as conduits and insulators, and attaches appliances on lines. Pulls lines through ducts by hand or by use of winch May dig holes for poles (EARTH-BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR (const.)], set poles, and tamp them in place, using hand tamp. When assisting in installation and removal of plant equipment, such as callboxes and clocks, in city locations, is designated LINEMAN, CITY. When patrolling telephone lines between communities is designated TOLL-LINE REPAIRMAN.

Title: PULLER
Definition: Unties and separates yarn skeins that have been joined in chain form for processes, such as bleaching and dyeing, and ties them into bundles: Pulls end of chain through guide over reel on which chain is wound. Unties skeins from each other and ties string around them to form bundles of about six skeins each. Hangs bundles on peg.

Title: MINERALOGIST
Definition: Examines, analyzes, and classifies minerals, gems, and precious stones: Isolates specimen from ore, rocks, or matrices. Makes microscopic examination to determine shape, surface markings, and other physical characteristics. Performs physical and chemical tests and makes X-ray examinations to determine composition of specimen and type of crystalline structure. Identifies and classifies samples. Develops data and theories on mode of origin, occurrence, and possible uses of minerals.

Title: SLOW-MOTION TESTER
Definition: Tests gas meters to determine ability of meters to register passage of small volume of gas and to detect leaks in soldered seams: Connects inlet of gasmeter to gas or air-pressure line and screws plug into meter outlet pipe. Connects one end of U-shaped glass tube, partly filled with water, to pressure line with rubber tubing, at a point on pressure line between gasmeter and shutoff cock. Turns cock to fill meter with either gas or air and shuts cock. Detects leaks in meter by noting drop of water level in glass tube, indicating a reduction of gas or air pressure in meter and on water in tube. Locates leaks by passing lighted torch over seams of gas-filled meter, causing escaping gas to ignite, and repairs leaks with solder. Screws gas cock to meter outlet and gas hose to meter inlet pipes, admits gas to meter, and allows small amount to escape at outlet. Ingnites gas at meter outlet and adjusts cock until flame is at specified height (denoting passage of specified small quantity of gas). Notes whether pointers of meter index dial remain stationary, indicating inability of meter to register passage of small volume of gas.

Title: SHOP CLERK, GRAIN ELEVATORS
Definition: Records data pertaining to receiving, storing, and shipping grain at grain elevator: Prepares lists of grain shipped and received. Keeps charts indicating location and contents of storage tanks. Prepares list of empty storage tanks. Assigns workers to Jobs according to work schedule. Collects and reviews timecards. Collects grain samples according to sampling pattern. Orades and weighs grain, using hand graders and scales. Records grade and weight of grain. Turns selector knobs and reads thermometers on control panel to ascertain temperature of grain at various levels in storage tanks. Weighs loaded railroad cars, using beam scale.

Title: MASTER OF CEREMONISE
Definition: Introduces entertainers, speakers, or other celebrities to audience, interspersing introductions with Jokes, songs, biographical sketch of speaker, or other specialties to entertain audience.

Title: GEOPHYSICAL-LABORATORY SUPERVISOR
Definition: director, geophysical laboratory; engineer, chief, geophysical laboratory; research engineer, geophysical laboratory; superintendent, geophysical laboratory. Plans and coordinates research activities of geophysical laboratory to develop new or improved instruments and methods for measuring physical characteristics of earths crust which provide data for petroleum exploration: Consults with management and field and laboratory technical personnel to determine specific phases of geophysical prospecting in which improved processes might be evolved by study and experimentation. Plans research programs and initiates and directs experiments to perfect prospecting procedures, explore possibilities of new theories, and develop improved or new instruments. Supervises workers designing, building, and field testing experimental instruments, such as seismometers, that record sound waves transmitted through earth formations. Supervises workers in repair and maintenance of prospecting instruments. Controls personnel actions, promotes company policies, and performs other administrative duties.

Title: LAWYER, CRIMINAL
Definition: Specializes in law cases dealing with offenses against society or the State, such as theft, murder, and arson: Interviews clients and witnesses to ascertain facts of case. Correlates findings and prepares case. Defends client against charges. Conducts case, examining and cross examining witnesses. Summarizes case to jury.

Title: STRINGING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: wire-machine operator, automatic; wiring- machine operator. Tends machine that automatically threads and fastens string or wire to paper tags for attachment to articles: Stacks punched paper tags in feeding mechanism and starts machine that threads wire or string through hole in tag and twists or loops and ties ends. Removes discharged tags and packs them in boxes for shipment.

Title: SALESMAN, FLOOR COVERINGS
Definition: Displays and sells floor coverings, such as carpets, rugs, and linoleum, in department store or specialty store, performing duties as described under SALESMAN: Displays rugs or samples of carpets to customer. Explains qualities of various rugs and carpets, such as composition, method of fabrication, and wearing qualities. May estimate cost and amount of covering required from floor plans or by measuring floor in customer's home.

Title: UNIT OPERATOR
Definition: plant-operator helper. Tends equipment in furnace-process plant that produces carbon black by partial combustion of crude oil, natural gas, or mixture of both: Starts individual units, such as reactors (furnaces), quenchers, precipitators, cyclones (grit collectors), pumps, compressors, and conveyors. Turns valves to regulate flow of water in quencher, feed rate of fuel and air, and movement of accumulated carbon black through equipment, as directed by PLANT OPERATOR, FURNACE PROCESS. Observes gages and meters to verify specified temperature, pressure, and rates of flow of materials. Opens inspection ports and observes flow of product through conveyors to detect jamming.

Title: FULLING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates fulling machine to shrink and compress felt: Places roll of felt padding in trough of machine containing lubricating agents such as soap solution. Threads end of felt beneath cam-actuated wooden blocks and onto take-off reel. Starts machine and pushes felt evenly beneath blocks that pound and flatten it. Measures rolls for specified thickness with gage. Turns and inverts pads to insure uniformity of size and shrinkage.

Title: TRAY-LINE WORKER
Definition: dietary aid; tray girl. Prepares and delivers food trays' to hospital patients, performing any combination of following duties on tray line: Prepares trays by placing on them such items as silver, fruit juice, sugar, cream, milk, and butter, filling vacuum bottles with coffee, and apportioning food servings according to diet list. Places servings in blender to make foods for soft or liquid diets. Examines filled tray for completeness and places on cart or dumbwaiter. Pushes carts to halls or ward kitchens. Serves trays to patients. Collects dirty dishes, stacks them on cart, and returns cart to kitchen. Washes dishes and cleans work area, tables, cabinets, and ovens. Collects and carries trash and garbage to designated containers. May be designated according type of food trays prepared as NOURISHMENT WORKER; SPECIAL-DIET WORKER; or duty on tray line as CART BOY.

Title: SKINNER
Definition: Skins sections of animals or whole animals, such as cattle, sheep, and hogs, performing any combination of the following tasks as a member of a crew: Slits skin on head of carcass, and pulls and cuts connective tissue (fascia) until head and neck are exposed, using knife. Severs head from carcass of animal, using knife and cleaver and places it on rack for inspection. Trims meat or fat from head skins. Slits remaining hide on carcass from breastbone to crotch. Pulls, cuts, and forces hand between hide and carcass to break connective tissue and separate it from neck, sides, shoulders, flanks, back, and tall of suspended carcass. Breaks and severs legs at knee joint, and removes such parts as dew claws, bungs, tails, and genital organs. Hoists cattle from floor and pulls hide off carcass by hand or using pinchers. Severs and exposes gullet and windpipe on small stock, using knife, and ties gullet to prevent leakage of fluid when viscera is removed. Slits womb of cattle with knife to remove slunk (premature calf). Shackles neck of slunk and pulls off skin, using winch. May saw brisket bone on cattle. May skin pork, using drawknife. May be designated according to kind of animal or portion of carcass skinned as BACKER; CALF SKINNER; CATTLE HEADER; 8LUNK SKINNER. See volume II for additional titles.

Title: GROOVER
Definition: Feeds material, such as plastic or wood, to rotating cutters of grooving machine, or places material in machine hopper, to cut grooves in material used to make products, such as lead pencils, picture frames, and boxes.

Title: SET-UP MAN, KICK PRESS
Definition: tool setter. Sets up and adjusts battery of foot-powered presses that shape and assemble metal buckles, buttons, and parts: Obtains numbered die and punch from rack according to size and shape of product. Installs die and punch in machine and adjusts stroke of press ram, using wrenches. Test-operates machine, and examines product for defects, such as malformation, misalinement, dents, burrs, and scratches. Measures product to verify dimensions, using micrometer.

Title: STOVE-CARRIAGE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates stove carriage to form bight (top bend) in floor covering and to feed floor covering into curing stoves, working as member of a team: Turns crank to position carriage over batten irons. Adjusts control to form bight and dip (lower curve). Places cool (hollow cylinder) in curve of dip to prevent kinks and sticking. Forms cushion for additional layer of floor covering by placing spacing strips of prescribed material over batten irons. Marks or labels sections for sampling May be designated according to tasks performed & BIGHT MAKER; CARRIAGE FEEDER.

Title: GARMENT STEAMER
Definition: Steam hand. Tends machine that removes wrinkles from knitted garments with steam and hot air: Hangs garments on studs of revolving disk of machine. Starts machine that subjects garments to steam spray and hot air as disk revolves. Removes steamed garments and stacks them on table.

Title: DRAGLINE OPERATOR
Definition: drag- lina runner; dragline shovelman. Operates power-driven crane equipped with dragline bucket, suspended from boom by cable that is dragged toward crane to excavate or move sand, gravel, clay, mud, coal, or other materials: Moves machine under its own power to worksite and directs workers engaged in placing blocks and outriggers to prevent capsizing when lifting heavy loads. Moves hand and foot levers to rotate crane on chassis and position boom above excavation point, to raise and lower boom, to lower bucket to material, to drag bucket toward crane to excavate or move material, to place bucket over unloading point, and to tilt bucket to release material. May be designated according to type of chassis or power unit as CRAWLER-DRAGLINE OPERATOR; DIESEL-DRAGLINE OPERATOR; ELECTRIC- DEAGLINE OPERATOR; GASOLINE-DRAGLINE OPERATOR; or material excavated as CLAY HOISTER (cement).

Title: RIGGER FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in installation and repair of rigging, and in hoisting and positioning machinery, equipment, and structural parts aboard ships. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: INSPECTOR, CHIEF
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in inspecting and grading quality of graphite electrodes during each step in manufacturing process: Keeps production records, such as grade and quality of electrodes manufactured and types of defects detected in electrodes during inspection. Determines inspection procedures according to plant production schedules and type and sise of inspection instruments to be used. Examines defective electrodes for possible salvage. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN0 (any ind.).

Title: FLORAL DESIGNER
Definition: Designs and fashions floral pieces and decorations: Selects natural and artificial flowers and foliage. Wires, pins, and wraps stems with floral tape, to form bouquets and corsages, sprays, wreaths, centerpieces, and other designs. Plans floral settings for events, such as weddings and balls, and decorates buildings, such as churches, homes, and dancehalls. May paint wreaths and sprays, using brush or spray gun.

Title: FILTER-PLANT FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in tending settling tanks and filtering machines to extract water from ore concentrate. Inspects machines and materials in process and adjusts water or reagent flow to regulate settling process. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: ECONOMIST BOTANIST
Definition: Develops wild and cultivated plants which might prove of value as crops: Grows plants under controlled conditions to determine best climate, soil, and other essentials. Selects, tests, and crossbreeds plants to obtain optimum qualities and quantities of plants for use as foods, drugs, fibers, and other purposes. May explore other countries for plants of economic worth.

Title: STROKE-BELT-SANDER OPERATOR
Definition: circular-sander operator; elbow-sender operator; stroke Sander. Operates stroke-belt-sanding machine to smooth flat surfaces of panels, milled stock, and wooden parts: Turns handwheels to set tension of sanding belt, adjust table height according to thickness of stock, and limit stroke of pressure shoe according to length of stock. Positions article to be sanded on table, and starts machine. Depresses lever to lower pressure shoe onto sanding belt, and force belt against surface of stock to sand it. Pushes and pulls table bearing stock under belt to smooth entire surface. Examines and feels sanded article to ascertain smoothness. Replaces worn sanding belts.

Title: FIELD-SERVICE ENGINEER
Definition: service engineer. Investigates performance reports of company-manufactured airplanes and recommends design changes to eliminate causes of flight or service difficulties: Inspects malfunctioning aircraft to determine necessary repairs or rework. Writes instructions for and oversees and expedites repair work involved. Performs preflight inspections of repaired or reworked aircraft to insure that work is completed in prescribed manner. Analyzes performance reports from customers and field representatives and recommends design changes. May prepare service handbooks and bulletins based on field reports, engineering principles, and knowledge of aircraft. May make sketches and drawings to illustrate repair methods, using drafting tools.

Title: PLASTIC-FRAME INSERT MAN
Definition: lens mounter. Inserts lenses into heated plastic eyeglass frames, alines lenses, and adjusts frames according to prescription specifications: Positions lens over lens opening of frame to determine if lens meets size and shape specifications. Heats frame in hot salt or glass beads to make plastic pliable. Fits lens into plastic eye-wire grooves of frame with fingers. Dips completed frame in cold water to set plastic and wipes it with towel. Measures distance between lenses with ruler. Heats bridge of frame until pliable and shapes and straightens frame, using cone-shaped metal rod. Turns lenses in frame to aline them, using rubber padded pliers. Places straightedge across back of frame to verify alinement of lens. Attaches and adjusts temples to frame, using jewelers' screwdriver and temple-adjusting pliers.

Title: INSPECTOR
Definition: garment examiner. Inspects garments or articles after cleaning and finishing, to verify that items meet company standards: Returns unsatisfactory articles, such as those with wrinkles, double creases, shine, spots, tears, broken seams, or missing buttons or belts to pressing, spotting, or repair units for correction. When examining garments to verify the quality of alteration and repairs may be designated as SEWING INSPECTOR.

Title: BUTTONER
Definition: Buttons or snaps garments to prepare them for pressing or packing. Cuts off excess threads between buttons or around buttonholes, using hand shears. May turn garment right side out before buttoning [GARMENT TURNER].

Title: RECLAMATION-MAN, METAL
Definition: Tends melting kettle to re melt metal scrap, dross, and skimmings to recover lead, cadmium, tine, or other nonferrous metals and cast it into pig molds for reuse: Charges kettle manually or using shovel or hoist. Ignites burner to melt and heat metal. Observes thermometer or color of molten metal and adjusts temperature control or turns valve to adjust fuel supply to obtain pour temperature. Stirs and skims molten metal, using bar and skimming tool. Drains, ladles, or pumps metal into molds. May remove castings from molds using bar and hammers. May stamp identifying numbers on castings, using hand stamp and mallet. May weigh castings and pack castings in wooden containers, using scale and hand tools.

Title: FILM-MAKING-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: Tends battery of automatic machines that produce paper film from pulp and coat it with adhesive chemical which binds sensitized emulsion to paper in subsequent operation. Moves levers to regulate speed of machines. Opens and closes valves to regulate flow of pulp and adhesive.

Title: FISH DRIER
Definition: drier man; flil linker; fiaker; linker tender. Dries fish, such as salmon, cod, herring, or sardines: Hangs fish on racks or poles, or places them in trays. Sets racks, poles, or trays In drying room, oven, or out in sun.

Title: GEAR-MILLING-MACHINE SET-UP OPERATOR
Definition: milling-machine operator, gear.Sets up and operates one or more gear milling machines to machine splines or gear teeth on metal blanks, according to specifications, tooling instructions, standard charts, and knowledge f gear types and gear milling procedures: Reads blueprints or Job order for product specifications, such as gear type, dimensions, and number of teeth, and tooling instructions, such as machine settings and cutter to be used. Clamps work piece in fixture or presses in onto arbor. Positions and secures cutter on spindle in relation to work piece, using wrenches. Moves levers or mounts gears in machine to set feed rates and rotation speeds of cutter and work piece in relation to each other. Starts machine, turns valve handle, and directs flow of coolant against cutter and work piece. Verifies conformance of machined gears to specifications, using such devices as micrometers, gear measuring wires, and special gear inspection equipment. May compute data, such as gear dimensions and machine setting

Title: PAD TAPER
Definition: Removes paper- covered excelsior pads from conveyor. Folds moistened gummed, paper tape over open ends to complete sealing of pads. Replaces sealed pad on conveyor.

Title: LENS-BLOCK GAGER
Definition: Determines whether lens blanks are positioned evenly on pitch-coated block by placing brass arc template on blanks and examining them for presence of light between blanks and template.

Title: MORSE SUPERVISOR
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of group of MORSE OPERATORS in a telegraph office, performing duties as described under SUPERVISOR (clerical).

Title: FOREMAN, PIPE LINES
Definition: gang supervisor, pipe lines; roustabout, head. Supervises and coordinates activities of crews of workers engaged in operating digging and pipelaying machines and in installation of pipe, pumps, valves, and meters to construct and maintain pipelines. Performs duties described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to work location as OIL-FIELD-PIPE- LINK FOREMAN.

Title: ROTARY CUTTER
Definition: piping blocker. Cuts leather into blockers (strips for use as trimming): Trims offal from leather, using hand knife. Places leather on cutting bed, smooths out wrinkles, and positions leather according to shape of piece and pattern of grain. Starts machine and guides leather over feed roller that forces it against row of revolving disks that cut leather into blockers.

Title: SEWING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates sewing machine on which presser foot has been removed to facilitate movement of material to repair defective embroidering or fill in blanks left by embroidering machine. Places material in embroidery hoop and guides it under needle.

Title: NOCK APPLIER
Definition: Glues nocks (notched plastic tips) over end of arrows: Dips end of arrow into glue. Presses nock over glued end of arrow alining it with grain of wood. May scrape excess lacquer from end of arrow.

Title: GRADER
Definition: Examines, classifies, and separates fruits, vegetables, and fish according to size, quality, color, condition, or species at receiving station or on conveyor line. May record grade on ticket and attach it to filled container. May be designated according to product graded, as FISH GRADER; TOMATO GRADER.

Title: MANIPULATOR OPERATOR
Definition: charging manipulator. Operates manipulator to transport metal stock from furnace and position and turn it on anvil of forging press or hammer: Moves levers and pedals to guide manipulator along floor or on overhead rails to furnace, grasps workpiece with jaws mounted on arm extending from manipulator cab, and transports it to press or hammer. Moves-controls of arm to turn and position workpiece on anvil as it is being shaped, following signals of HEAVY FORGER.

Title: PROTOTYPE-DE-ICER ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembles and tests experimental electric or pneumatic airplane de-icers according to specifications: Assembles experimental de-icers [DE- ICER ASSEMBLER, ELECTRIC]. Tests de-icers under simulated flying conditions for pressure leaks, electrical resistance, and shorts, using electric or air pressure testing equipment. Examines de-icers to locate ruptures, cracks, or weak spots. Records test results. May instruct customers in installation, repair, or maintenance of de-icers.

Title: COUNTER CLERK
Definition: ad clerk. Receives orders for classified advertising from customers, in person or by telephone, at reception counter of newspaper: Writes copy, determines rate charge from rate schedule, and assigns box numbers to anonymous advertisements. Collects payment for advertisements. Keeps accounts and records of transactions and transmits collections to accounting office. Writes and forwards orders. Signs for incoming express or special mail items. May relieve CASHIER I (clerical). When taking classified advertisements over telephone, may be designated TELEPHONE AD-TAKER.

Title: SAMPLER
Definition: Collects samples of materials,such as benzol, coal, coke, sewer water, sulfate, and tar, and prepares them for laboratory analysis: Shovels coal into crusher to grind samples for analysis. Drops weighed sample of coke from drop-door bucket to steel- plate, shakes shattered coke through screen of specified mesh and weighs and records weights of large and small sized coke. Weighs sample, dries it in oven, and re- weighs sample of quenched coke to determine moisture content. Identifies type and source of sample on container label. May be designated according to source of sample as SAMPLEMAN, OVENS.

Title: DAMPROOFER
Definition: see WATER- PROOTER HELPER.

Title: MASH GRINDER
Definition: Tends mill and agitating vat that grind and mix flour and malt with water, to make malted milk mash: Turns water valve to fill vat and starts grinder and agitator. Transfers flour and malt from storage silo by moving micro- switch controls to deposit specified amounts through automatic scale hopper into mill or by placing counters on meters and starting conveyors that carry measured amounts through grinder into vat. Observes ammeter and grain and water meters to detect deviations from specifications, and moves levers to alter grain and water flow. Pumps mash to mash kettles. May heat mash by mixing steam with water.

Title: BELT MAKER
Definition: Operates sewing machine to join cloth strips and backing to form belts for garments: Positions belt material under needle of machine and depresses pedal to start machine. Cuts belt material to specified length, using scissors. Positions end of belt under needle of machine and sews end of belt. Positions end of belt on rod and pulls it downward over rod to turn belt right side out. Inserts belt end into buckle frame, folds end, and sews fold together to attach buckle to belt.

Title: DEMOGRAPHER
Definition: Plans and conducts censuses, surveys, and experiments to obtain and analyze statistics concerning human populations, including their size, growth, family structure, distribution, movement, and composition (age, race, sex, economic status).

Title: COVER MAKER
Definition: Casts concrete cell covers and fabricates cover components, using power tools and hand press: Casts covers. Cuts carbon rods into anode pins of specified length, using power- saw. Dips pins In linseed oil and fastens caps on pins, using handpress. May tend arbor press to Install pins in anodes. CELL-MAKING FOREMAN,

Title: EXAMINER
Definition: Inspects and packs umbrellas preparatory to shipping: Examines covers for pattern matching, tears, and stitching defects. Inspects frames for defects, such as bent ribs and missing tips. Stacks rejected umbrellas for correction. Inserts accepted umbrellas in wrappers and packs them in cartons according to types, sizes, and pattern designs. Records types and quantities of packed umbrellas. May hold opened umbrella over steam nozzle to smooth covering. EXAMINER-MENDER (tex. prod, n.e.c.) . Operates sewing machine to mend defects in lace web: Inspects web for broken threads and incomplete design and marks defects with colored crayon or ties loose knot over damaged parts. Threads machine with matching yarn and positions defective area of fabric under needle. Depresses pedal and guides fabric under needle to duplicate design on undamaged section of web. Clips machine threads close to fabric when design is mended.

Title: TURRET-LATHE SET-UP MAN
Definition: Sets up turret lathes for LATHE OPERATORS, PRODUCTION and operates lathes to machine first-run work pieces (TURRET -LATHE SET- UP OPERATOR.]. May maintain set-up, performing such tasks as changing worn tools and adjusting cutting speeds, feed rates, and depth of cut. May instruct workers in machine operation.

Title: LABOR ECONOMIST
Definition: Compiles and interprets data on labor supply and demand, wages and hours, and productivity to forecast labor trends and to recommend or establish labor policies: Devises or perfects arbitration and conciliation techniques for settling labor disputes. Studies nature and effect of labor legislation, social insurance, industrial accident provisions, welfare plans, and industrial factors upon labor force. May act as adviser or consultant on labor problems to Government agencies, business organizations, or industrial groups. May act as arbitrator or conciliator in labor disputes.

Title: SANDER, HAND
Definition: Smooths surface of wooden articles, such as furniture parts, mirror frames, caskets, and cabinet panels, preparatory to finishing, or between finish coats, using sandpaper and steel wool. May be designated as FINISH SANDER; FIRST-COAT SANDER.

Title: BOWLING-BALL GRADER AND MARKER
Definition: grade and center marker. Lays out axis through light and heavy centers of bowling balls and gages and grades balls according to size, color, and quality: Floats bowling ball in mercury pool and locates and marks center of light side, using plumb bob and grease pencil. Places ball in jig and locates center of heavy side, using center gage. Examines ball for defects and color quality, measures size with ring gage, and marks data to be engraved under trademark, using grease pencil. Places rejected balls aside for reworking.

Title: ROLLER OPERATOR
Definition: Tends roller-printing machine that colors embossed letters or designs on wooden blocks for games, such as dominoes and anagrams: Adjusts height of machine roller to accommodate block. Positions blocks in racks, and places racks on conveyor belt that feeds them into machine for coloring. Removes blocks from conveyor and stacks them for drying.

Title: LAST REPAIRMAN
Definition: fast grinder; fast repairer. Repairs wooden shoe lasts: Sorts out splintered shoe lasts. Drills holes in splintered areas of last, using electric drill. Brushes glue on wood or fiber pegs and hammers pegs into holes in last. Cuts pegs off at surface of last, using handsaw or powered saw. Piles repaired area of last with hand file to smooth surface. May stamp style, size, and width numbers on last and be designated WOODEN-LAST STAMPER.

Title: THREAD-CUTTER TENDER
Definition: Tends machine that cuts and removes threads which connect designs on machine-embroidered fabrics: Stitches length of embroidered fabric to lead cloth, using stitching machine. Adjusts clearances, starts thread-cutting machine, and guides fabric so as to break threads. Pulls out loose thread and turns fabric over to repeat operation. Cleans threads from machine, using brush.

Title: COMPOUND-COATING MACHINE OFF-BEARER
Definition: end pecker. Removes tin can ends from discharge rack of coating machines: Inspects rubber base coating compound on can ends for conformity to specifications. Notifies PUNCH-PRESS SETUP MAN (any ind.) of machine jam or defects in can ends. Packs ends In cartons and places carton on pallet.

Title: EXTRACTOR-AND-WRINGER OPERATOR
Definition: wringer-and-extractor operator. Tends equipment that extracts salicylic acid from sodium salicylate solution by precipitation and dries salicylic acid by centrifugal force: Opens valves to pump sodium salicylate solution and required amount of sulfuric add into extractor columns that absorb phenol from solution and cause precipitation of salicylic acid crystals. Heats extractors to specified temperature to increase rate of precipitation of salicylic acid. Pumps off solution of sulfuric add and phenol, and pumps slurry of salicylic add through cooler to centrifugal drier. Tends centrifugal drier that forces out water to dry salicylic add.

Title: TAXI SERVICEMAN
Definition: Services taxicab fleet and maintains terminal yard and office in orderly condition: Refuels and lubricates taxicabs[GAS AND OIL MAN (auto. ser.)]. Changes and repairs tires[TIRE CHANGER (auto, ser.): TIRE REPAIRMAN (auto, ser.)].Cleans parking area and removes rubbish. Cleans offices and equipment[PORTER I (any ind.)].

Title: SAW SETTER
Definition: aaw maker. Maintains stonecutting saws in operating condition: Removes broken and bent saw blades from gangsaws. Cuts new blades to fit and cuts holes in ends for mounting in saw frame. Straightens bent blades, using hammer. Sets up gangsaws, spacing, tightening, and leveling blades so that stone will be cut properly. May supervise workers engaged in setting blocks of stone on cars to see that they are properly squared and leveled for cutting on gangsaws.

Title: ADHESION TESTER
Definition: Tends equipment to test adhesion of rubber to metal on rubber products: Adjusts equipment holding aids to fit product to be tested, using handtools. Threads holding aids into product and positions in testing equipment. Pulls levers to apply hydraulic pressure that stretches, compresses, or bends product as specified. Inspects product for defects, such as tears or adhesion breakaway while under pressure. Stamps approved products with Inspection number and drops rejects in box for reprocessing.

Title: GEAR-SORTING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: coding-machine operator; gear ceding machine operator; inspector, gear sorting. Operatesgear-sorting machine to measure dimensional deviations of gears within specified tolerances: Positions gear and master gear on machine spindles and meshes together. Fastens tracing finger of recording chart to machine. Reads dial indicator and turns handles to set gears in specified position in machine. Starts machine to revolve gears. Reads dial indicator and recording chart. Compares readings with color chart to determine specified color to paint gear to enable workers to match gears of similar dimensions.

Title: SECONDS INSPECTOR
Definition: mending Inspector. Inspects knitted garments that have been repaired, and grades repaired garments according to number and types of defects. Mends defects to increase quality grade, using needle and thread. Separates garments according to quality, size, color, and style. May fold garments, insert them in cellophane bags, and pack in boxes.

Title: LINERMAN
Definition: Replaces metal liners in ore processing equipment, such as mills, crushers, chutes, and hoppers: Loosens worn liners, using wrenches. Signals ELECTRIC- BRIDGE-OR-GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to remove old liner and position replacement. Adjusts new liner, using sledge, pry bar, and hydraulic jacks. Bolts liner in place, using wrenches. May tend furnace to melt sine, and pour molten sine to resurface worn liners.

Title: ROLLING - DOWN - MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: pleating-machine operator; poll-down man; swing-folding-machine operator; un- rolling-machine operator. Tends machine that unwinds cloth from rolls and discharges it into loose or folded form to facilitate further processing: Inserts metal rod through roll of cloth and lifts cloth into feeding position. Sews end of cloth roll to cloth in machine, using portable sewing machine. Positions truck under delivery roller or swing folding attachment and starts machine. Pushes loaded trucks from area. May observe cloth to detect defective seams and resew seams to prevent raveling.

Title: DRESSER TENDER
Definition: Thread drawer; warp dresser; warper tender; warping -mill operator.
